Export Prometheus metrics

This commit export kuryr_cni_requests_duration, kuryr_quota_free_count,
kuryr_port_quota_per_subnet, kuryr_pod_creation_latency metrics to
Prometheus.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 07:51:01.000000000', 'message': '[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)
'}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I44437cff96fd51f70028315cdf3840abbbc08451

[{'created': '2021-09-16 17:27:49.000000000', 'message': "Add AMD Sev instance creation test

Test the ability to launch an AMD Sev guest instance [1]. Create the
necessary image/flavor to launch this type of guest. Confirm
memoryBacking and  launchSecurity are present in the guest XML:

  <memory unit='KiB'>65536</memory>
  <currentMemory unit='KiB'>65536</currentMemory>
  <memoryBacking>
    <locked/>
  </memoryBacking>
...
  <launchSecurity type='sev'>
    <cbitpos>47</cbitpos>
    <reducedPhysBits>1</reducedPhysBits>
    <policy>0x0033</policy>
  </launchSecurity>

Validate all devices with model type virtio also has iommu enabled for
the driver:

    <memballoon model='virtio'>
      <stats period='10'/>
      <alias name='balloon0'/>
      <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x04' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/>
      <driver iommu='on'/>
    </memballoon>

Lastly confirm AMD Sev is active from within the guest.

Test leveraged methods in test_vgpu so those methods were migrated to
the base class.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: I5f86de6ccd6e65df612ba473e74d27be42d3f67e
"}, {'created': '2021-10-05 15:21:18.000000000', 'message': "Add AMD Sev instance creation test

Test leveraged methods in test_vgpu so those methods were migrated to

commit_message:
Add AMD Sev instance creation test

Test the ability to launch an AMD Sev guest instance [1]. Create the
necessary image/flavor to launch this type of guest. Confirm
memoryBacking and  launchSecurity are present in the guest XML:

  <memory unit='KiB'>65536</memory>
  <currentMemory unit='KiB'>65536</currentMemory>
  <memoryBacking>
    <locked/>
  </memoryBacking>
...
  <launchSecurity type='sev'>
    <cbitpos>47</cbitpos>
    <reducedPhysBits>1</reducedPhysBits>
    <policy>0x0033</policy>
  </launchSecurity>

Validate all devices with model type virtio also has iommu enabled for
the driver:

    <memballoon model='virtio'>
      <stats period='10'/>
      <alias name='balloon0'/>
      <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x04' slot='0x00' function='0x0'/>
      <driver iommu='on'/>
    </memballoon>

Lastly confirm AMD Sev is active from within the guest.

Test leveraged methods in test_vgpu so those methods were migrated to
the base class.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: I5f86de6ccd6e65df612ba473e74d27be42d3f67e

messages: [{'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2021-09-29 07:02:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-10-01 15:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nI was helping Maysa with the issue related to the PrettyTable today, locally the l-c tests failed if I only changed the requirements to remove the cap for 0.8, I pushed https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/+/812154 with some changes I had to make to run tox -e lower-constraints locally in my setup'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-10-01 15:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2021-10-05 14:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 07:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Drop constrain of versions <0.8 for PrettyTable.

We had restricted version for <0.8 and >0.7.2 (which is 8 years old
btw), which probably breaks the interface, although current version,
which is 2.2.1 works just fine with kuryr-status command. With this
patch, we allow to install latest version, so that it will not break
requirements-check test.

Change-Id: I5542db6829e01b4767fe1df11b421446bc26b6a3
'}]
commit_message:
Drop constrain of versions <0.8 for PrettyTable.

We had restricted version for <0.8 and >0.7.2 (which is 8 years old
btw), which probably breaks the interface, although current version,
which is 2.2.1 works just fine with kuryr-status command. With this
patch, we allow to install latest version, so that it will not break
requirements-check test.

Change-Id: I5542db6829e01b4767fe1df11b421446bc26b6a3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-21 08:20:10.000000000', 'message': "Try deinit odl_features in TestOdlFeaturesNoFixture setUpClass

test_feature_configs_does_not_mutate_default_features sporadically fails
with the following:
testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: {} !=
{'operational-port-status': '', 'bgpvpn-vni': ''}

commit_message:
Try deinit odl_features in TestOdlFeaturesNoFixture setUpClass

test_feature_configs_does_not_mutate_default_features sporadically fails
with the following:
testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: {} !=
{'operational-port-status': '', 'bgpvpn-vni': ''}
This patch runs odl_features.deinit at the beginning of the test to run
it on a clean beases.

Change-Id: I2185c30f260f95ef2e0b90c14399260702837f29
Closes-Bug: #1835216
(cherry picked from commit ef695842c97236d8eba23ffe883f6cead7a153dc)

commit_message:
Add client and member listener timeouts for persistence (Ex. SSH)

Add possibility to specify connection timeouts for SSH listeners.
These values are available in openstacksdk:
https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/95ee95f52c28ee4647886dbb702e0a1015c88604/openstack/load_balancer/v2/listener.py#L89

[{'created': '2021-09-29 10:56:10.000000000', 'message': 'nova-manage: Ensure mountpoint is passed when updating attachment

This optional kwarg to the nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update
method ends up stashed in the connector passed to c-api and sets the
device associated with the attachment within Cinder. While this being
unset has no real world impact it should be kept the same as the
original attachment for completeness.

The Cinder fixture is extended to mimic the behaviour of
nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update prior to calling Cinder
allowing us to assert the value stashed in the connector and attachment
record.

Closes-Bug: #1945450
Change-Id: Ib2938a407598bf2dd466aae41700f350d2d34418
'}]
commit_message:
nova-manage: Ensure mountpoint is passed when updating attachment

This optional kwarg to the nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update
method ends up stashed in the connector passed to c-api and sets the
device associated with the attachment within Cinder. While this being
unset has no real world impact it should be kept the same as the
original attachment for completeness.

The Cinder fixture is extended to mimic the behaviour of
nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update prior to calling Cinder
allowing us to assert the value stashed in the connector and attachment
record.

Closes-Bug: #1945450
Change-Id: Ib2938a407598bf2dd466aae41700f350d2d34418

commit_message:
Enable CSRF token handling for swift dashboard

Swift dashboard uses DELETE request, which is not covered by current CSRF
token injection method. Also, CSRF token is not passed through HTTP at
this dashboard, so CSRF_COOKIE_HTTPONLY option breaks the dashboard
operation. Proposed patch fixes both issues

Closes-Bug: #1943618
Change-Id: If6a20bc363fe72f0693c008c79af76143344aec8

commit_message:
WIP: Include more information in policy debug logging

You get about half of what you need to debug authorization decisions
when you set oslo.policy to DEBUG. It would be nice to know the result
and the actual check string in addition to the rule, credentials, and
target.

Attempt to make that change here.

Change-Id: I161e61987e5c02af940bf90b843e9c744c6da7b3

[{'created': '2021-10-05 13:38:56.000000000', 'message': "image_uploader: Excluding schemaVersion 1 from copy_registry_to_registry

When media_type is None, that probably means that we're handling a
schemaVersion 1 and there's no config manifest. We shouldn't go through
this code path when there's no media_type.

Change-Id: I6bb5b16c43bf4f825a3832eb017f76c43215b7dc
"}]
commit_message:
image_uploader: Excluding schemaVersion 1 from copy_registry_to_registry

When media_type is None, that probably means that we're handling a
schemaVersion 1 and there's no config manifest. We shouldn't go through
this code path when there's no media_type.

Change-Id: I6bb5b16c43bf4f825a3832eb017f76c43215b7dc

commit_message:
Allow for OCI manifests

We always convert to docker metadata for the undercloud, but we need to
be able to handle OCI source manifests from a remote registry.  We
previously added support to handle the conversion however it wasn't
complete since we only request docker manifests from remote registries.

Change-Id: I3ca3d7c08d08525ead15c50d2e44c9db310859e7
Related-Bug: #1860585

commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

Note that the interface doesn't actually have tests.  This is just to
migrate away from the deprecated testr module.
Add .zuul.yaml so that the project can be merged

Change-Id: I0b8ba13297fe9f08e398045598f2b73e60facadd

commit_message:
Do not merge: Debugging https://pad.lv/1933966

Test the gate with minimal mirrors dropped from the gss mirror_list
in the test bundles. More about this at:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-glance-simplestreams-sync/+bug/1933966/comments/4

This also includes the changes from:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-octavia-diskimage-retrofit/+/811211
to ensure pip changes are in place.

Change-Id: I62e82d28c5548beca227164b12a6eff00d63251a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 13:30:13.000000000', 'message': 'Update sriov config service to handle nic partitioned PF

Create VFs using udev rules are required for attaching
and removing PF from a VM. On a reboot, when udev rules
trigger VF creation script and when a VF is attached to
vfio-pci driver, some of the VFs on that PF are not
initialized properly, resulting in VF not found issue.
Though it looks like driver issue, this patch avoids
this scenarios by removing the nic-paritioned VF from
the udev rule, as when one of the VF is attached to host,
the PF cannot be used by the VM.

Change-Id: Ic6738de42b9aa0346f48060c143c5f779b67867e
(cherry picked from commit fcf3d9cd126f30ecfe166aa5271a2f212a51a5a6)

The function setUp_pf_stubs() was added in the vdpa patch:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-net-config/+/798926/
Since there is a dependency on this API for the tests of this patch,
it has been added here

Change-Id: I2738765f2fdb1bf0e88eccbce345f677b82116fe
'}]
commit_message:
Update sriov config service to handle nic partitioned PF

Create VFs using udev rules are required for attaching
and removing PF from a VM. On a reboot, when udev rules
trigger VF creation script and when a VF is attached to
vfio-pci driver, some of the VFs on that PF are not
initialized properly, resulting in VF not found issue.
Though it looks like driver issue, this patch avoids
this scenarios by removing the nic-paritioned VF from
the udev rule, as when one of the VF is attached to host,
the PF cannot be used by the VM.

Change-Id: Ic6738de42b9aa0346f48060c143c5f779b67867e
(cherry picked from commit fcf3d9cd126f30ecfe166aa5271a2f212a51a5a6)

The function setUp_pf_stubs() was added in the vdpa patch:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-net-config/+/798926/
Since there is a dependency on this API for the tests of this patch,
it has been added here

Change-Id: I2738765f2fdb1bf0e88eccbce345f677b82116fe

Yes, this is what I mentioned before. Our storage software currently has more than one version. The driver of the previous version cannot be completely adapted to the new storage version. We need to add a lot of changes. The original driver is compatible with the storage software version of 1.2.40. This version adapts to 1.3.9. Without knowing whether the new and old drivers can coexist, we hope that the driver that the latest software version adapts to is on the main line."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2020-05-15 11:26:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 > 1.3.9. Without knowing whether the new and old drivers can coexist,
 > we hope that the driver that the latest software version adapts to
 > is on the main line.

1) I see most of the code is same as the previous driver code, i'm really not able to trace out the difference
2) If this type of refactoring is to be done, it should be done without introducing any new features to ease the reviewers.
Here i'm not able to find the Snapshot Attachment code change easily.

What we can do is,
1) propose a refactor patch for this type of change
2) a new patch to introduce new features into the new driver so it's easy to trace the difference"}, {'account_id': 13425, 'date': '2021-10-05 13:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:

'}, {'created': '2021-10-05 09:02:41.000000000', 'message': 'Enable consistent network device naming

CentOS cloud images come with net.ifnames=0 on the kernel command line,
which disables consistent network device naming. This does not provide a
good experience on bare metal because NIC ordering can vary. This is
specific to cloud images: an ISO installation would use consistent
network device naming.

We now set net.ifnames=1 in the DIB default environment to use
consistent network device naming. The parameters `nofb nomodeset
gfxpayload=text` are also set to preserve defaults from DIB.

To restore the existing behaviour, set DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE to
`nofb nomodeset gfxpayload=text net.ifnames=0` in the
kolla_bifrost_dib_env_vars_extra dictionary.

Change-Id: I20465eab4e0aec6620578a92d3bdbddcec0954df
'}]
commit_message:
Enable consistent network device naming

CentOS cloud images come with net.ifnames=0 on the kernel command line,
which disables consistent network device naming. This does not provide a
good experience on bare metal because NIC ordering can vary. This is
specific to cloud images: an ISO installation would use consistent
network device naming.

We now set net.ifnames=1 in the DIB default environment to use
consistent network device naming. The parameters `nofb nomodeset
gfxpayload=text` are also set to preserve defaults from DIB.

To restore the existing behaviour, set DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE to
`nofb nomodeset gfxpayload=text net.ifnames=0` in the
kolla_bifrost_dib_env_vars_extra dictionary.

Change-Id: I20465eab4e0aec6620578a92d3bdbddcec0954df

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 21:41:04.000000000', 'message': 'Check for passwords at old path during tripleo deploy

Commit ecafbae4ee7c403a3ef62e362c261585aabbec5c updated tripleo deploy
to use a different working directory. That broke upgrades because the
passwords file was still at the old path, and the passwords can not
change during a tripleo deploy upgrade. This patch checks the old
location for a passwords file, and if present, updates the passwords
with the values read from the old file before generating any missing
ones.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I547ba1a7409290f4888e53dd45a883c263f0670f

commit_message:
Check for passwords at old path during tripleo deploy

Commit ecafbae4ee7c403a3ef62e362c261585aabbec5c updated tripleo deploy
to use a different working directory. That broke upgrades because the
passwords file was still at the old path, and the passwords can not
change during a tripleo deploy upgrade. This patch checks the old
location for a passwords file, and if present, migrates it to the new
location.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I547ba1a7409290f4888e53dd45a883c263f0670f

[{'created': '2021-10-04 07:56:06.000000000', 'message': 'Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

it by hand.

(cherry picked from commit 288233da8cbbad3af374a75db4ba53096823822d)
'}]
commit_message:
Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

This change creates two new scripts that are executed by ReaR during
restore that do exactly what is needed, eliminating the need for doing
it by hand.

Change-Id: Ib7c699b737980c5495cce2cf42f5847fda0f72f5
(cherry picked from commit 288233da8cbbad3af374a75db4ba53096823822d)

commit_message:
Make Galera desync operation more resilient

Sometimes, after a hard reboot of a controller node the Galera database
is up&running but not yet able to receive requests via the mysql.sock
socket, even if it is already opened. It takes few seconds to get it
working, but during that time, we should keep retrying the desync
operation until it connects to the database.

Closes-Bug: #1945639

Change-Id: I71fe4c14195ebcf11912753425ea15bc679b14f9

it's not clear to me what this is actually solving other than preventing a mass restart if we touch the systemd template. But we shouldn't be doing that within a support but rather across version boundaries which will have a restart anyway because the container image changes."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:33:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> it's not clear to me what this is actually solving other than preventing a mass restart if we touch the systemd template. But we shouldn't be doing that within a support but rather across version boundaries which will have a restart anyway because the container image changes.

@Alex, so we have a 4 scenarios to apply this change:

1) new installation
2) minor update (via z-streams, once we have this backported)
3) non-ffe upgrade
4) ffe-upgrade

cases 1 and 4 would not be disrupted since there would be no workloads to disrupt
cases 2 and 3 *would* disrupt all workloads

If you have better ideas how to handle all that, please go for it, feel free to take this over.
Meanwhile, there is another, not related to cs9 problem that requires fixes to all units delivered for all previous releases, see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2010135"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

meant to say FFU, not ffe :)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:38:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> we shouldn't be doing that within a support

tl;dr no, we should, please see the linked bz"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2021-09-30 08:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'Allow global systemd units changes for new envs

Global changes in systemd units managed by tripleo cause
recreation of corresponding containers, which disrupts
dataplane. Prohibit such changes when upgrading environments
(by default). Or allow it, for some cases, like FFU.
New param SystemdDisruptiveChanges manages that behavior.

Change-Id: I206bb5e6ffad471daafd02e46357d0ffe1d24da1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Global changes in systemd units managed by tripleo cause
recreation of corresponding containers, which disrupts
dataplane. Prohibit such changes by default. That case corresponds
to minor updates or in-place upgrading of existing environments.

For some cases, like FFU, or new deployments, it may (should) be
allowed by users explicitly. New param SystemdDisruptiveChanges
manages that behavior.

Closes-bug: #1945792
Change-Id: I206bb5e6ffad471daafd02e46357d0ffe1d24da1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Knob to control disruptive changes in systemd units

Global changes in systemd units managed by tripleo cause
recreation of corresponding containers, which disrupts
dataplane. Prohibit such changes by default. That case corresponds
to minor updates or in-place upgrading of existing environments.

For some cases, like FFU, or new deployments, it may (should) be
allowed by users explicitly. New param SystemdDisruptiveChanges
manages that behavior.

Closes-bug: #1945792
Change-Id: I206bb5e6ffad471daafd02e46357d0ffe1d24da1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Switches to creating a service unit for dnsmasq in order to
facilitate standalone usage and testing of puppet-ironic outside
with Centos-Stream 9 where package changes are anticipated.

This is because the underlying service configuration required does
not require configuration files, and only a unit for the installed
package where the arguments are configured into the systemd launch,
just like how a container would be launched.

with Centos-Stream 9 where package changes are anticipated.

On Centos-Stream 9, users should effectively be forced over to
using dnsmasq automatically, and deployments running on older
versions should see their xinetd configuration disabled by default
with a switch over to using dnsmasq.

The higher level controls for defaults can also be changed for
the purpose of backporting such that prior releases are not
automatically switch to using dnsmasq unless they have to be
run with dnsmasq based upon known package availability.

This is because the underlying service configuration required does
not require configuration files, and only a unit for the installed
package where the arguments are configured into the systemd launch,
just like how a container would be launched in TripleO project
and derivitive works.

Change-Id: I5d388acfb96fa3e3a555a119ff72feabdd1cdf87

commit_message:
Support use of dnsmasq as tftp service

Switches to using the new ironic-dnsmasq-tftp-server service[1], which
manages the dnsmasq process in order to facilitate standalone usage and
testing of puppet-ironic outside with Centos-Stream 9 where package
changes are anticipated.

On Centos-Stream 9, users should effectively be forced over to using
dnsmasq automatically.

The higher level controls for defaults can also be changed for
the purpose of backporting such that prior releases are not
automatically switch to using dnsmasq unless they have to be run with
dnsmasq based upon known package availability.

Note that just setting tftp_use_xinetd=false in an existing deployment
doesn't remove the xinetd service completely, because of limitation
caused by current implementation of puppet-xinetd, and users are
responsible to remove service, package and etc properly before
switching to the new service.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/ironic-distgit/+/34691

Change-Id: I5d388acfb96fa3e3a555a119ff72feabdd1cdf87

replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

but not from the Logical_Router_Static_Route record itself.

py > 3.8.
Remove ussuri from voting jobs, use it for experimental only.

Change-Id: Ib5e331ca851474bc4db8287d6a8abaafe75724cd
'}, {'created': '2021-05-05 02:54:18.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib5e331ca851474bc4db8287d6a8abaafe75724cd
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib5e331ca851474bc4db8287d6a8abaafe75724cd

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9c9c2f5f0bec27efe03ba45a27c15b51d69e7dd3

commit_message:
Fix using host_routes in VIP subnet with amphorav2

Ensure that amphorae_network_config parameter is not modified in
AmphoraPostVIPPlug. Modifying it would break amphorav2 persistence by
introducing non-serializable elements in the subnet dict

Story: 2008955
Task: 42580

Change-Id: I8f0d3ba1d083c7e37e7e26617826400a538a0890
(cherry picked from commit 76606b4c4dc9595a015afb4c997f5d02ac7a7343)
(cherry picked from commit 6367a849e9c51dc886bcdc7f99f9ee3f0f7a2516)

subject: Don't use 'requests.PreparedRequest'
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 08:24:17.000000000', 'message': 'Don't use 'requests.PreparedRequest'

We're using 'requests.PreparedRequest' in one place in the tests.
However, the requests docs have a warning that one shouldn't do this:

  Instances are generated from a Request object, and should not be
  instantiated manually; doing so may produce undesirable effects.

It seems we're now seeing just such an effect, as requests has started
attempting to do proxy-related things resulting in the following error:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/unittest/mock.py", line 1183, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/oslo_vmware/tests/test_service.py", line 518, in test_send_with_local_file_url
    resp = transport.session.send(request)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 636, in send
    kwargs.setdefault('proxies', self.rebuild_proxies(request, self.proxies))
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 301, in rebuild_proxies
    if 'Proxy-Authorization' in headers:
    TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

Do what we should have done from the beginning and use
'requests.Request.prepare' instead.

[1] https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.PreparedRequest

Change-Id: I072c64904298cf83cb113e402d85fb62626f39f7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e991194cbd82925c8bac43cb979f9262a49850e6)
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use 'requests.PreparedRequest'

We're using 'requests.PreparedRequest' in one place in the tests.
However, the requests docs have a warning that one shouldn't do this:

  Instances are generated from a Request object, and should not be
  instantiated manually; doing so may produce undesirable effects.

It seems we're now seeing just such an effect, as requests has started
attempting to do proxy-related things resulting in the following error:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/unittest/mock.py", line 1183, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/oslo_vmware/tests/test_service.py", line 518, in test_send_with_local_file_url
    resp = transport.session.send(request)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 636, in send
    kwargs.setdefault('proxies', self.rebuild_proxies(request, self.proxies))
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 301, in rebuild_proxies
    if 'Proxy-Authorization' in headers:
    TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

Do what we should have done from the beginning and use
'requests.Request.prepare' instead.

[1] https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.PreparedRequest

Change-Id: I072c64904298cf83cb113e402d85fb62626f39f7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e991194cbd82925c8bac43cb979f9262a49850e6)

commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt name after first newline character

Passing newline as extra dhcp option name to the DHCP agent causes
issues with configuration of the dnsmasq process for the network.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's name before building dnsmasq's config.

Closes-bug: #1943930
Change-Id: Iab2832e750ff5ef09c5dcacae4dbff4f9e62bc2d
(cherry picked from commit 5abd1fb61018e497b369712a0952bb1a18022142)

subject: Add support for invalid version documents
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-11 10:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-09-11 10:34:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is highly speculative. This has come out of my work on [1]. In short, because these older versions of placement (Queens and earlier) didn't expose the status field, it's not possible use any of the version discovery. I'm pretty sure it would be possible to side-step this and force a given version of the API but I have yet to figure out how.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/745375"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 10:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-11 10:31:58.000000000', 'message': "Add support for invalid version documents

Older versions of placement didn't include the status field in their
version discovery documents. This was fixed in placement in [1] but
there are clouds out there in the wild running this version and it's not
possible to use keystoneauth to talk to them. Resolve this by allowing
us to continue functioning in the absence of this field.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/575117

Change-Id: I988df57271b57af60fd191b340a8bc735a4549bc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for invalid version documents

Older versions of placement didn't include the status field in their
version discovery documents. This was fixed in placement in [1] but
there are clouds out there in the wild running this version and it's not
possible to use keystoneauth to talk to them. Resolve this by allowing
us to continue functioning in the absence of this field.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/575117

Change-Id: I988df57271b57af60fd191b340a8bc735a4549bc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

This distinction is unnecessary. Only allow cores to make the

commit_message:
Drop +2/-2 Backport-Candidate label values for oslo

This distinction is unnecessary. Only allow cores to make the
determination on whether a patch is a backport candidate or not. There's
nothing stopping anyone else from deciding to do the backport even
without the label if they think it's necessary.

Change-Id: Ic6233d2219c31ec52333c1a22a06a7910d4b3b86
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/735175/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 35m 20s'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2020-06-12 08:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Thanks Stephen, great to fill in this gap in the docco ... couple suggestions inline.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2020-06-12 08:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Correction to the proposed rule of thumb up-thread:

"circa 4Gb for the host OS plus circa 1Gb per guest for the QEMU process overhead plus (memory overcommit ratio minus 1) times physical memory"'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2020-06-15 17:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

This is a clear gap in the docs, so I'm happy to see this going in.

I feel like it's probably worthwhile to be specific about virt driver behaviors when we can, but make it clear which things those are. Maybe each thing could have a "and this is how it is for KVM" paragraph? We could get the hyperv people to do the same. For ironic, it should be easy to state "no overcommit" although I think there are some cases where they've used overcommit as a hack for imperfect fitting, so we might want to ask someone from the ironic team to weigh in.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 10:53:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
docs: Add a guide on overcommit

Our documentation for how to configure overcommit ratios, along with the
implications of same, is limited. Address this.

Change-Id: Ia6f696e1d2f68e0756753c08b0f11dec878229ee
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove unreachable codepaths

'ResourceTracker.pci_tracker' is always set in '_init_compute_node',
which is called from 'update_available_resource' (via
'_update_available_resource'). This function is, in turn, always called
in 'ComputeNode._update_available_resource_for_node', which is in turn
called by 'pre_start_hook' (via 'update_available_resource'). There's no
reason to handle it not being set.

We do need to set it manually in the unit tests to work around the fact
they're not initializing everything correctly. This was being done
previously but it now centralized.

Change-Id: I95c7d025c31b372ed441c438a2836043fc135b59
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-10-03 17:13:57.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Group IPs by network UUID, not network names

Multiple '/server' APIs include details about the fixed and floating IPs
associated with the instance. Previously, these were grouped by network
name. This was problematic when networks shared the same name, since we
only included the IPs of the first of a possible N network in the
responses. Resolve this by using network UUIDs as the key instead. This
is a change in API behavior so an API microversion is introduced.

Turns out this needs a spec too, so I should re-propose [1]

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/servers-ips-non-unique-network-names.html

Change-Id: Ia494603479ff5777237382d9d7039ae7f1378f1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1708316
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Group IPs by network UUID, not network names

Multiple '/server' APIs include details about the fixed and floating IPs
associated with the instance. Previously, these were grouped by network
name. This was problematic when networks shared the same name, since we
only included the IPs of the first of a possible N network in the
responses. Resolve this by using network UUIDs as the key instead. This
is a change in API behavior so an API microversion is introduced.

Turns out this needs a spec too, so I should re-propose [1]

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/servers-ips-non-unique-network-names.html

Change-Id: Ia494603479ff5777237382d9d7039ae7f1378f1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1708316

subject: WIP: Add support for translation generation
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 11:36:51.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add support for translation generation

There are currently a few different ways [1][2] we generated
translations in OpenStack, which involve external scripts that have to
guess what the user intended. Instead of doing this, let's have Sphinx
do the heavy lifting for us. This has a couple of advantages but the
biggest one is that we get this for free, through openstackdoctheme's
use across the OpenStack ecosystem.

This is incomplete: still to do:

- Figure out how things move from 'locale' to 'doc/source/locale' (for
  nova, at least)
- Add generation of an index file
- Make the behavior configurable (off by default) via an environment
  option
- Testing and hardening
- Misc TODOs littered through the code

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/zuul-jobs/blob/2ea7a1b6b/roles/build-releasenotes/tasks/main.yaml#L10
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/a0684ace5/bin/docstheme-build-translated.sh

Change-Id: Ia0274e3405e8c44ed87fe669651d2293a5e554be
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Add support for translation generation

There are currently a few different ways [1][2] we generated
translations in OpenStack, which involve external scripts that have to
guess what the user intended. Instead of doing this, let's have Sphinx
do the heavy lifting for us. This has a couple of advantages but the
biggest one is that we get this for free, through openstackdoctheme's
use across the OpenStack ecosystem.

This is incomplete: still to do:

- Figure out how things move from 'locale' to 'doc/source/locale' (for
  nova, at least)
- Add generation of an index file
- Make the behavior configurable (off by default) via an environment
  option
- Testing and hardening
- Misc TODOs littered through the code

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/zuul-jobs/blob/2ea7a1b6b/roles/build-releasenotes/tasks/main.yaml#L10
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/a0684ace5/bin/docstheme-build-translated.sh

Change-Id: Ia0274e3405e8c44ed87fe669651d2293a5e554be
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Hello,

Some comments.

First you need to put mypy in lower-constraint to pass the requirements-check (this is why I -1 your patch set).

Second, do we want to run mypy checks during CI jobs? If yes in this I guess you need to design a zuul job related to this.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-01-31 09:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also it could be worth to put `.mypy_cache/` to `.gitignore`'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-01-31 10:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-01-31 10:32:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Couple of comments. On a related note, is there any reason to use mytype over pytype? The latter is looser and might  be able to handle the few issues you're seeing here."}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2020-02-07 14:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

@Stephen: So, there is mypy, pytype and pyright (and probably some others). I was under the impression that "mypy", being the oldest of the three, was the "de facto" standard, but I might be mistaken.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-07 15:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> @Stephen: So, there is mypy, pytype and pyright (and probably some
 > others). I was under the impression that "mypy", being the oldest
 > of the three, was the "de facto" standard, but I might be mistaken.

Nope, you're probably correct. Mostly asking to get your opinion because I'm deliberating between the two in nova land at present :)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 10:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
WIP Add support for making sub-elements clearer

The current output is a single list of names. So for things like the
nova servers list, where "servers" is the top level key and it is a
list of objects, there is no distinction in the produced table between
"servers" and "name" - even though "name" is a property in each of the
objects in the list "servers".

Take an inspiration from how the GCE docs work and allow for listing
a property prefixed with its container.

This patch currently depends on two patches to nova so that the results
of using this on some real API docs can be shown in the
gate-nova-api-ref-src job. If we like it, we'll want to break the
depends-on so we can land and release.

Depends-On: I6a56fc019eefceb5d962f5ed3cc95206dd2457c3
Change-Id: Id1133362f7cb2c047dc0fd11d4e9a4f06dfbe360

commit_message:
Add [vault]base_path option

This patch adds a new option to the VaultKeyManager to be able to set
an arbitrary base path to store/retrieve secrets from.  For example,
setting base_path=openstack/cinder will store and retrieve secrets from
the openstack/cinder/{secret_id}.  It defaults to '/' for backwards
compatibility.

This is the first step to stop using the vault root token.  It will
also enable the use of fine-grained policy in Vault.

Change-Id: Iaba10b7ffc732da64e9333d336252c97418c0c5e

commit_message:
Remove tftp-server package from ironic-pxe container

With Ie75aa0f2994a4cf662905b912231a12e3bd8afe7 merging,
the inclusion of the tftp-server package is now redundant
and can be removed.

commit_message:
Fix lower constraints

decorator-3.4.0 now errors on setup due to using use_2to3, and
networkx-1.1.0 attempts to import fractions.gcd, which is math.gcd
from python-3.5 onwards.

Change-Id: I4f4ddebb079a95708be3dd76086b039db18d5948

subject: Fix BackOffLoopingCall error so it is not misleading
messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-09-16 17:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nObvious fix. Fast approving.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-16 17:18:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix BackOffLoopingCall error so it is not misleading

The backoff looping call logging was previously making
a decision on if timeout had or was going to be exceeded
by including idle time and it's internal time, however
this is misleading as the overall operation may take
30 seconds externally, a user initiated timeout of 30
seconds is requested, and the error might say something
like 18 seconds has passed, when that is incorrect.

The logic is actualy correct, the logging was just
misleading.

Fixes the exception message to use the total time.

Change-Id: Ie9ef5a53abb24f6ab7de0ad57a672c0a8d7ff0ee
"}]
commit_message:
Fix BackOffLoopingCall error so it is not misleading

The backoff looping call logging was previously making
a decision on if timeout had or was going to be exceeded
by including idle time and it's internal time, however
this is misleading as the overall operation may take
30 seconds externally, a user initiated timeout of 30
seconds is requested, and the error might say something
like 18 seconds has passed, when that is incorrect.

The logic is actualy correct, the logging was just
misleading.

Fixes the exception message to use the total time.

Change-Id: Ie9ef5a53abb24f6ab7de0ad57a672c0a8d7ff0ee

[{'created': '2021-09-17 07:55:15.000000000', 'message': "Redfish RAID: Use identity instead of durable_name

- map disks to `Storage`, not `StorageControllersListField`
to have access to `Storage` fields, including
`identity` and possibly `storage_controllers`
- durable_name is not present on all controllers,
for example, BOSS-S1
- in known supported BMC, iDRAC, in target RAID config
user would specify identity such as 'RAID.Integrated.1-1'
instead of durable name such as '54cd98f0c3648800'
- data structure of controller.identifiers make it harder
to get Storage resource by durable_name

This change is not user visible and does not impact
current code as values set are not used for anything yet.

Change-Id: I5fa47c5ee4691a70974caafbc262d62790c03382
(cherry picked from commit c4a538c76192b66837a9a386c0b1a199d51ff882)
"}]
commit_message:
Redfish RAID: Use identity instead of durable_name

- map disks to `Storage`, not `StorageControllersListField`
to have access to `Storage` fields, including
`identity` and possibly `storage_controllers`
- durable_name is not present on all controllers,
for example, BOSS-S1
- in known supported BMC, iDRAC, in target RAID config
user would specify identity such as 'RAID.Integrated.1-1'
instead of durable name such as '54cd98f0c3648800'
- data structure of controller.identifiers make it harder
to get Storage resource by durable_name

This change is not user visible and does not impact
current code as values set are not used for anything yet.

Change-Id: I5fa47c5ee4691a70974caafbc262d62790c03382
(cherry picked from commit c4a538c76192b66837a9a386c0b1a199d51ff882)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:55:47.000000000', 'message': "Redfish RAID: Use identity instead of durable_name

- map disks to `Storage`, not `StorageControllersListField`
to have access to `Storage` fields, including
`identity` and possibly `storage_controllers`
- durable_name is not present on all controllers,
for example, BOSS-S1
- in known supported BMC, iDRAC, in target RAID config
user would specify identity such as 'RAID.Integrated.1-1'
instead of durable name such as '54cd98f0c3648800'
- data structure of controller.identifiers make it harder
to get Storage resource by durable_name

This change is not user visible and does not impact
current code as values set are not used for anything yet.

Change-Id: I5fa47c5ee4691a70974caafbc262d62790c03382
(cherry picked from commit c4a538c76192b66837a9a386c0b1a199d51ff882)
"}]
commit_message:
Redfish RAID: Use identity instead of durable_name

- map disks to `Storage`, not `StorageControllersListField`
to have access to `Storage` fields, including
`identity` and possibly `storage_controllers`
- durable_name is not present on all controllers,
for example, BOSS-S1
- in known supported BMC, iDRAC, in target RAID config
user would specify identity such as 'RAID.Integrated.1-1'
instead of durable name such as '54cd98f0c3648800'
- data structure of controller.identifiers make it harder
to get Storage resource by durable_name

This change is not user visible and does not impact
current code as values set are not used for anything yet.

Change-Id: I5fa47c5ee4691a70974caafbc262d62790c03382
(cherry picked from commit c4a538c76192b66837a9a386c0b1a199d51ff882)

Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- drop groovy-victoria bundle
- rebuild to pick up charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

messages:

you can add .gitignore file too for this repo and have .stestr.conf there'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-02-18 13:56:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

.stestr.conf is needed here, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-02-18 15:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1
> 
> .stestr.conf is needed here, thanks!

it would not remove from repo but stop commit on master if any local copy is modified. Same way you have in other repo - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-interface-dashboard-plugin/+/774851/1/.gitignore#2'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-02-18 16:14:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1
> > 
> > .stestr.conf is needed here, thanks!
> 
> it would not remove from repo but stop commit on master if any local copy is modified. Same way you have in other repo - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-interface-dashboard-plugin/+/774851/1/.gitignore#2

The difference is that the .stestr.conf file is a CONFIGURATION file for the unit tests, whereas .coverage and cover/ are outputs of the unit test coverage run that we don't want in the repository.  i.e. we want .stestr.conf (and what to be able to change it and commit changes to it) as it tells the unit tests what to do, but we don't want the other files as they are outputs of the unit test run (if tox -e cover is used).  Is that clear?"}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-05-20 11:48:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Upstream Barbican has bumped up its default for the configuration keys
max_allowed_request_size_in_bytes and max_allowed_secret_in_bytes to
25kB and 20kB respectively (c59f2a6b). This change adopts those values

commit_message:
Expose max request and secret size config options.

Upstream Barbican has bumped up its default for the configuration keys
max_allowed_request_size_in_bytes and max_allowed_secret_in_bytes to
25kB and 20kB respectively (c59f2a6b). This change adopts those values
to be used in all the supported releases and exposes them via juju
config.

Closes-Bug: #1946018
Change-Id: I3dcb30f5de6367de2aa5c26bb59a79893fb8e578

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If09845034214e6f26538e8841b621bd1613ac452

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I65eabefbc493bae70b5ce346417024bf754141e2

Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

subject: Ignored error state cache for new requests
messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-10-04 18:04:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-10-05 06:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 18:04:20.000000000', 'message': 'Ignored error state cache for new requests

A possibility exists where inspector *can* fail upon inspection if
the database connectivity was lost on a prior action. This is because
the last database transport is potentially bad and fails upon load for
the transaction. The cache can then end up with an "error" state entry,
which upon retrying can fail becasue it is already in error state

Because there really are no guarentees regarding database failures,
the best thing to do is to not trust the prior cache state if it is
in error and to reset it to starting upon new introspection requests.
This prevents operators from *having* to perform process restarts to
force all loads to be from the database unless they manage to have a
multi-inspector cluster and get another inspector node to inspect in
the mean time.

Change-Id: I04ae1d54028862642d043f3a8f3af99405863325
Story: 2008344
Task: 41246
Related: rhbz#1947147
(cherry picked from commit d972dc93cd4e2b8fdc66e1fd69a2e947de5810cc)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignored error state cache for new requests

A possibility exists where inspector *can* fail upon inspection if
the database connectivity was lost on a prior action. This is because
the last database transport is potentially bad and fails upon load for
the transaction. The cache can then end up with an "error" state entry,
which upon retrying can fail becasue it is already in error state

Because there really are no guarentees regarding database failures,
the best thing to do is to not trust the prior cache state if it is
in error and to reset it to starting upon new introspection requests.
This prevents operators from *having* to perform process restarts to
force all loads to be from the database unless they manage to have a
multi-inspector cluster and get another inspector node to inspect in
the mean time.

Change-Id: I04ae1d54028862642d043f3a8f3af99405863325
Story: 2008344
Task: 41246
Related: rhbz#1947147
(cherry picked from commit d972dc93cd4e2b8fdc66e1fd69a2e947de5810cc)

subject: nova: Give service time to restore
messages: [{'account_id': 24780, 'date': '2021-10-05 05:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2021-10-05 05:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2021-10-05 06:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 05:25:48.000000000', 'message': 'nova: Give service time to restore

nova-service-cleaner job deletes the service which are down. If the
database is down, the service will go down as well. When database comes
back up, all the services starts to come back to up status. If the
nova-service-cleaner is run in this interim time, the service that
were down gets deleted. These would have come up if the job had not
run. Adding sleep to this job to give service time to come back up
if recovering. The sleep is set to 2 times the report_interval.

Change-Id: Ia292d19508e9449ccb40d1100b1d56b1283e5d53
'}]
commit_message:
nova: Give service time to restore

nova-service-cleaner job deletes the service which are down. If the
database is down, the service will go down as well. When database comes
back up, all the services starts to come back to up status. If the
nova-service-cleaner is run in this interim time, the service that
were down gets deleted. These would have come up if the job had not
run. Adding sleep to this job to give service time to come back up
if recovering. The sleep is set to 2 times the report_interval.

Change-Id: Ia292d19508e9449ccb40d1100b1d56b1283e5d53

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:04:50.000000000', 'message': 'Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then

commit_message:
Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

This change creates two new scripts that are executed by ReaR during
restore that do exactly what is needed, eliminating the need for doing
it by hand.

Change-Id: Ib7c699b737980c5495cce2cf42f5847fda0f72f5
(cherry picked from commit 288233da8cbbad3af374a75db4ba53096823822d)

commit_message:
Drop archive policy from enable-legacy-telemetry

Adding it there will basically enforce using the archive policy
high all over, and will prevent using any other.

Change-Id: I9d471633d5650544f2fd9a2b00bd9aa166c737c3
(cherry picked from commit 10e0652199083de0b607cc2107b81106a8e09813)

commit_message:
Fix libvirt/qemu logs location

Fix bind-mount to point /var/log/containers/libvirt/(qemu)
on the host, via the shared NovaLibvirtLogging attribute.

Remove the nested libvirt/qemu path bind-mount since the outer libvirt
directory is sufficient to hold the qemu logs as well. For that,
bind-mount it with the shared mounts propagation mode.

Related: rhbz#2005340
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/812020
Change-Id: Iccbae5589aa4a4fc449f23b82755dea1f54f5678
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 56a58f88e9c6b6e7e80e7bc5752816108df87cbc)

Hello,

We are in pre-release freeze. Only release-critical regressions, or legal compliance issues, or bugs making it otherwise impossible to install and use the software on release day, should be considered by the release management team for a pre-release freeze exception. 

Does these changes enter one of these exceptions?'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-04 13:37:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd defer actual decision to Heat folks but I believe this is considered to be a critical regression. The volume v2 API has been removed from cinder during Xena but heat still depends on that removed API by default. These two fixes are needed to update parameter defaults to use v3 API instead of v2 API.

Note that these two fixes are being merged to master and backport to Xena will be merged shortly. That's why currently this patch is failing at tox job.
 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/heat/+/812345/"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-10-04 13:43:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Release Heat Xena RC2

... to include the following two changes to remove usage of volume v2
API.

4cf0ff641 Drop support for Block Storage API v2
c34bebae9 Add volumev3 to shared_services_types by default

Change-Id: Ic335e7c8535843e66f50693763f163ad03a691a3

commit_message:
[iRMC] Set polling after RAID is built

Avoid resume clean before raid is actually configured.
After creating the RAID, set up polling will notify ironic to wait for the
RAID configuration to complete before proceeding to the next step instead of check IPA.

Story: #2009231
Task: #43336

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I7a551199224c24ca270b8b02d76b39386632c94f

subject: [iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration

"}, {'created': '2021-09-15 07:46:17.000000000', 'message': "[iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration

When testing raid feature with a Fujitsu iRMC server, after raid configuration is created successfully and manual clean completed normally,
in the next step, auto clean, Ironic will encounter a `NoneType` error which causes the failure of auto clean.

```
Unexpected error when processing next clean step. TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

This `NoneType` error occurs because Ironic resumes clean without waiting for IPA to get the clean steps, and then it tries to read the
clean steps which should be a list but actually is none.
During auto clean, resume clean should be triggered by IPA, but in this case, it is triggered by a iRMC periodic task which checks
the progress of running raid config.
This error does not occur every time, sometime raid can be configured, auto clean can complete without error and the node can be deployed successfully.

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5a1c5708bdc1709e928f0faf7e18396e260dc551

commit_message:
[iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration

Fixed the bug of repeated resume cleaning due to the value of `fgi_status` not being updated correctly when obtaining the
RAID configuration status of the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type.

```
Unexpected error when processing next clean step. TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

This `NoneType` error occurs because ironic resumes clean without waiting for IPA to get the clean steps, and then it tries to read the
clean steps which should be a list but actually is none.
During auto clean, resume clean should be triggered by IPA, but in this case, it is triggered by a iRMC periodic task which checks
the progress of running raid config.
This error does not occur every time, sometime raid can be configured, auto clean can complete without error and the node can be deployed successfully.

Story: #2009206
Task: #43265

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Add ability to noop a service

We want also be able to noop_resource('service'). In order to do that we
also add stubs for status, start and stop. Without this it fails with:
[root@controller-0 openstack-puppet]# NET_HOST=true DEBUG=True PROCESS_COUNT=1 CONFIG=/root/bandini.json python3 /var/lib/container-puppet/container-puppet.py 2>&1 | tee /tmp/puppet.log |grep Error:

commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt name after first newline character

Passing newline as extra dhcp option name to the DHCP agent causes
issues with configuration of the dnsmasq process for the network.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's name before building dnsmasq's config.

Closes-bug: #1943930
Change-Id: Iab2832e750ff5ef09c5dcacae4dbff4f9e62bc2d
(cherry picked from commit 5abd1fb61018e497b369712a0952bb1a18022142)

subject: Reimplement os_tripleo_baremetal_node_introspection
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-09-29 03:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-04 14:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 03:52:41.000000000', 'message': "Reimplement os_tripleo_baremetal_node_introspection

Triggering introspection via the introspection API is discouraged when
also using the Ironic API, because Ironic will be out of sync with
introspection state. This is suspected to be causing occasional errors
in CI and with end users.

This module was one of the very first to be converted from mistral, so
hasn't benefited from the concurrency and logging patterns in later
modules.

The internal implementation of this module has been rewritten, and now
does the following:

- Concurrency uses a ThreadPoolExecutor instead of a custom pool with
  async calls
- Waiting for state changes uses existing openstacksdk wait functions
- Logging ends up in a 'logging' result value instead of calling
  module.log which ansible does not pass back to the caller
- Introspection is triggered by setting the node provision state to
  'inspect'
- Node is powered off after a successful introspection
- Auth configuration relies on environment, as for other modules
- Debug tasks are added to the playbook to print the logging

This was reverted previously due to a 50% failure rate in the periodic
featureset001, the locking interaction between inspector and ironic
has now been fixed so the root cause of these failures is now
resolved.

Change-Id: I24eb7014cc657f50be63767af439208eb854dfb6
Closes-Bug: 1903786
(cherry picked from commit e54faf1e102545d083e45b227167a8de4459994a)
"}]
commit_message:
Reimplement os_tripleo_baremetal_node_introspection

Triggering introspection via the introspection API is discouraged when
also using the Ironic API, because Ironic will be out of sync with
introspection state. This is suspected to be causing occasional errors
in CI and with end users.

This module was one of the very first to be converted from mistral, so
hasn't benefited from the concurrency and logging patterns in later
modules.

The internal implementation of this module has been rewritten, and now
does the following:

- Concurrency uses a ThreadPoolExecutor instead of a custom pool with
  async calls
- Waiting for state changes uses existing openstacksdk wait functions
- Logging ends up in a 'logging' result value instead of calling
  module.log which ansible does not pass back to the caller
- Introspection is triggered by setting the node provision state to
  'inspect'
- Node is powered off after a successful introspection
- Auth configuration relies on environment, as for other modules
- Debug tasks are added to the playbook to print the logging

This was reverted previously due to a 50% failure rate in the periodic
featureset001, the locking interaction between inspector and ironic
has now been fixed so the root cause of these failures is now
resolved.

Change-Id: I24eb7014cc657f50be63767af439208eb854dfb6
Closes-Bug: 1903786
(cherry picked from commit e54faf1e102545d083e45b227167a8de4459994a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 04:05:37.000000000', 'message': 'Image upload: handle whole-disk image as default

For the image upload command, if overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2
file exists in the --image-path directory then this will be used as
the default value of --os-image-path.

If overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2 is the explicit or implicit
value of --os-image-path then --whole-disk will be implicitly set.

Otherwise the current default behaviour will continue (default image
overcloud-full.qcow2, whole-disk flag defaults to false)

With this change, the documentation can continue to call this command
without extra arguments whether uploading a whole-disk or partition
overcloud image.

Change-Id: I15e6148bafac05d8800665bf6b7268bec49dad6f
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 915ddcb6159bc38b99846be6cee8d11c011b14da)

commit_message:
Image upload: handle whole-disk image as default

For the image upload command, if overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2
file exists in the --image-path directory then this will be used as
the default value of --os-image-path.

If overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2 is the explicit or implicit
value of --os-image-path then --whole-disk will be implicitly set.

Otherwise the current default behaviour will continue (default image
overcloud-full.qcow2, whole-disk flag defaults to false)

With this change, the documentation can continue to call this command
without extra arguments whether uploading a whole-disk or partition
overcloud image.

Change-Id: I15e6148bafac05d8800665bf6b7268bec49dad6f
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 915ddcb6159bc38b99846be6cee8d11c011b14da)

commit_message:
Make Galera desync operation more resilient

Sometimes, after a hard reboot of a controller node the Galera database
is up&running but not yet able to receive requests via the mysql.sock
socket, even if it is already opened. It takes few seconds to get it
working, but during that time, we should keep retrying the desync
operation until it connects to the database.

Closes-Bug: #1945639

Change-Id: I71fe4c14195ebcf11912753425ea15bc679b14f9

commit_message:
Don't use upper-constraints with molecule

We were always using the upper-constraints when creating tox
environments, however there is currently an issue with molecule and
openstack upper-constraints that is preventing it from being used.
Until molecule can be fixed to work with openstack upper-constraints,
lets drop this configuration. We are already adding the constraints to
the doc and release notes jobs.

https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule/pull/3244

STABLE-Only: This also pins molecule to <3.5 as that requires updates
to the metadata structure.

Change-Id: I91ebaa059dc2451bba739a0a2de917e2f3c2aa21
Related-Bug: #1942704
(cherry picked from commit 949414244467e8436c07c2563643267adfb11a75)

messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-09-29 03:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-04 14:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-29 03:55:09.000000000', 'message': 'Properly detect default whole-disk image

Previously the whole-disk default detection worked by looking for
overcloud-full.raw with no .vmlinuz or .initrd file, but our tooling
will never produce this by default.

The overcloud image build command will generate
overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2, and the upload command will
convert this to overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.raw. This commit changes
the whole-disk default detection to simply look for the presence of
file overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.raw.

Change-Id: I936c2054e03e269be4dc7a6c2f02878feb288f5d
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 25e099891dc94230b9c5a0dab7cab1f510334a5d)
'}]
commit_message:
Properly detect default whole-disk image

Previously the whole-disk default detection worked by looking for
overcloud-full.raw with no .vmlinuz or .initrd file, but our tooling
will never produce this by default.

The overcloud image build command will generate
overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.qcow2, and the upload command will
convert this to overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.raw. This commit changes
the whole-disk default detection to simply look for the presence of
file overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.raw.

Change-Id: I936c2054e03e269be4dc7a6c2f02878feb288f5d
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 25e099891dc94230b9c5a0dab7cab1f510334a5d)

[{'created': '2021-09-29 03:55:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add playbook cli-overcloud-node-growvols.yaml

Just like cli-overcloud-node-network-config.yaml, this playbook will
be run by the "openstack overcloud node provision" directly after
provisioning so that whole disk images will have their /var volume
grown to 100%.

If the growvols utility is not found the playbook will halt without
error, because this will be an overcloud-full partition image which
grows the root partition with the growpart utility.

There will be a mechanism in the "openstack overcloud node provision"
command to specify different growvol arguments. This will not be
required for most nodes, but swift storage nodes will have to grow
both /srv and /var.

Change-Id: I0a847ad4077a02a02ad817dd189a6a31c3637a93
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 4fed3472689c3970b6784317686e9477419f9f9e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add playbook cli-overcloud-node-growvols.yaml

Just like cli-overcloud-node-network-config.yaml, this playbook will
be run by the "openstack overcloud node provision" directly after
provisioning so that whole disk images will have their /var volume
grown to 100%.

If the growvols utility is not found the playbook will halt without
error, because this will be an overcloud-full partition image which
grows the root partition with the growpart utility.

There will be a mechanism in the "openstack overcloud node provision"
command to specify different growvol arguments. This will not be
required for most nodes, but swift storage nodes will have to grow
both /srv and /var.

Change-Id: I0a847ad4077a02a02ad817dd189a6a31c3637a93
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit 4fed3472689c3970b6784317686e9477419f9f9e)

commit_message:
Fix front/back-end options

Follow the rule:
 - *log is only needed for frontend usually (by default)
 - tcpka and other "durability" related options are set for both
   sides, based on a service case by case
 - move the frontend-only options, like 'client X' to frontend hashes
 - move the backend-only options, like 'server Y' to backend hashes

Add missing haproxy listen options

Follow-up I3fd753fc3a4522faf565999a019df0f4095ebd9c
and add the options removed from the listen_options
mistakenly.

Change-Id: I3fd753fc3a4522faf565999a019df0f4095ebd9c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4e89b1cc7a017b733937af04654a7320f2c032da)
(cherry picked from commit 705e9888d09b794fdf99673e5966da121844c396)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:03:51.000000000', 'message': 'Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

This change creates two new scripts that are executed by ReaR during
restore that do exactly what is needed, eliminating the need for doing
it by hand.

Change-Id: Ib7c699b737980c5495cce2cf42f5847fda0f72f5
(cherry picked from commit 288233da8cbbad3af374a75db4ba53096823822d)
'}]
commit_message:
Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

This change creates two new scripts that are executed by ReaR during
restore that do exactly what is needed, eliminating the need for doing
it by hand.

Change-Id: Ib7c699b737980c5495cce2cf42f5847fda0f72f5
(cherry picked from commit 288233da8cbbad3af374a75db4ba53096823822d)

"}]
commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt name after first newline character

Passing newline as extra dhcp option name to the DHCP agent causes
issues with configuration of the dnsmasq process for the network.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's name before building dnsmasq's config.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py

Closes-bug: #1943930
Change-Id: Iab2832e750ff5ef09c5dcacae4dbff4f9e62bc2d
(cherry picked from commit 5abd1fb61018e497b369712a0952bb1a18022142)
(cherry picked from commit c85abee26de55d4ec37619c2cc691612414546ac)

commit_message:
Improvements to yum-config module

This patch adds a couple of improvements to yum-config module:
- change the default behavior for yum-config repo,
  which now tries to update an existent configuration file and,
  if the file does not exists, create a new one.
- Adds more options to repo config operation.
- Check OS version info before enable dnf-manager command.
- Add python2 support to yum-config 'repo' and 'global'.
- Update molecule to run yum-config 'repo' and 'global' tests
  for CentOS-7

Change-Id: I654fb32ad4e987b43baea17641aa60de86a78ff9
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix context from_dict() for system_scope

A previous patch[1] added "system_scope" to the context for to_dict()
but the from_dict() method was not updated. This caused the
system_scope to always be None.
This patch corrects that by adding "system_scope" to the list of
values that may need to be extracted from the context dict.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.context/+/530509

Change-Id: Ica23d5c4183a692de3cb65a7ad72b19f47988ca6

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with

directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

it by hand.

commit_message:
Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

This change creates two new scripts that are executed by ReaR during
restore that do exactly what is needed, eliminating the need for doing
it by hand.

Change-Id: Ib7c699b737980c5495cce2cf42f5847fda0f72f5
(cherry picked from commit 288233da8cbbad3af374a75db4ba53096823822d)
