revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 14:49:27.000000000', 'message': 'Don't use 'requests.PreparedRequest'

We're using 'requests.PreparedRequest' in one place in the tests.
However, the requests docs have a warning that one shouldn't do this:

  Instances are generated from a Request object, and should not be
  instantiated manually; doing so may produce undesirable effects.

It seems we're now seeing just such an effect, as requests has started
attempting to do proxy-related things resulting in the following error:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/unittest/mock.py", line 1183, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/oslo_vmware/tests/test_service.py", line 518, in test_send_with_local_file_url
    resp = transport.session.send(request)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 636, in send
    kwargs.setdefault('proxies', self.rebuild_proxies(request, self.proxies))
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 301, in rebuild_proxies
    if 'Proxy-Authorization' in headers:
    TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

Do what we should have done from the beginning and use
'requests.Request.prepare' instead.

[1] https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.PreparedRequest

Change-Id: I072c64904298cf83cb113e402d85fb62626f39f7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use 'requests.PreparedRequest'

We're using 'requests.PreparedRequest' in one place in the tests.
However, the requests docs have a warning that one shouldn't do this:

  Instances are generated from a Request object, and should not be
  instantiated manually; doing so may produce undesirable effects.

It seems we're now seeing just such an effect, as requests has started
attempting to do proxy-related things resulting in the following error:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/unittest/mock.py", line 1183, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/oslo_vmware/tests/test_service.py", line 518, in test_send_with_local_file_url
    resp = transport.session.send(request)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 636, in send
    kwargs.setdefault('proxies', self.rebuild_proxies(request, self.proxies))
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 301, in rebuild_proxies
    if 'Proxy-Authorization' in headers:
    TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

Do what we should have done from the beginning and use
'requests.Request.prepare' instead.

[1] https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.PreparedRequest

Change-Id: I072c64904298cf83cb113e402d85fb62626f39f7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-09-28 07:56:47.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent --password from leaking in failed command output

There is cases when a command times out or when it fails
that we and Puppet [1] will output the raw command that
was executed.

For a user create command that output contains the
--password argument passed down to openstack CLI which
causes sensitive passwords to be leaked into log files
of the system executing Puppet, these can then be shipped
of from the system into a remote syslog and still be in
plain text.

This tries to use Ruby gsub with a regular expression
matching the two cases and instead output [redacted secret]
the same way we do with config provider.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/main/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L286

Change-Id: I4cad8f88fc7b67bb7aa4330832fc47bac41ae9df
(cherry picked from commit 16ce2f30de42b1fcec55a58d24b3de346e1f9353)

commit_message:
Prevent --password from leaking in failed command output

There is cases when a command times out or when it fails
that we and Puppet [1] will output the raw command that
was executed.

For a user create command that output contains the
--password argument passed down to openstack CLI which
causes sensitive passwords to be leaked into log files
of the system executing Puppet, these can then be shipped
of from the system into a remote syslog and still be in
plain text.

This tries to use Ruby gsub with a regular expression
matching the two cases and instead output [redacted secret]
the same way we do with config provider.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/main/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L286

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/+/812189
Change-Id: I4cad8f88fc7b67bb7aa4330832fc47bac41ae9df
(cherry picked from commit 16ce2f30de42b1fcec55a58d24b3de346e1f9353)
(cherry picked from commit fa7ce171e6be4202ba933569fec3c6dc17aa4b4b)

[{'created': '2021-09-24 10:31:45.000000000', 'message': "Remove dhcp_extra_opt name after first newline character

Passing newline as extra dhcp option name to the DHCP agent causes
issues with configuration of the dnsmasq process for the network.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's name before building dnsmasq's config.

Closes-bug: #1943930
Change-Id: Iab2832e750ff5ef09c5dcacae4dbff4f9e62bc2d
(cherry picked from commit 5abd1fb61018e497b369712a0952bb1a18022142)

commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt name after first newline character

Passing newline as extra dhcp option name to the DHCP agent causes
issues with configuration of the dnsmasq process for the network.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's name before building dnsmasq's config.

Closes-bug: #1943930
Change-Id: Iab2832e750ff5ef09c5dcacae4dbff4f9e62bc2d
(cherry picked from commit 5abd1fb61018e497b369712a0952bb1a18022142)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I4ceb0afbdc65dceac9625540d393d6f8fea7d134

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-16 11:43:06.000000000', 'message': 'Choose to wait forever to try to acquire an external lock

Proposed solution : wrapping the "blocking" option from the "acquire" method
of the external lock (fasteners.InterProcessLock) used in the "synchronized"
decorator implemented in "lockutils.py".

Change-Id: I409da79007c9ba4fb8585da881e3d56998b0b98b
'}, {'created': '2021-06-24 07:49:09.000000000', 'message': "Add support for non-blocking locks

This adds support for a non-blocking behavior of the lock : the context-based
lock now raises an AcquireLockFailedException if the lock can't be acquired on
the first try.

At a higher layer, we just caught this exception inside the 'synchronized'
decorator to prevent calling the wrapped function. In which case, we then
trace this acquisition failure.

For now at least, disabling blocking is not supported when using fair locks
because the ReaderWriterLock.write_lock() provided by the fasteners module
doesn't implements this behavior.

Change-Id: I409da79007c9ba4fb8585da881e3d56998b0b98b
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for non-blocking locks

This adds support for a non-blocking behavior of the lock : the context-based
lock now raises an AcquireLockFailedException if the lock can't be acquired on
the first try.

At a higher layer, we just caught this exception inside the 'synchronized'
decorator to prevent calling the wrapped function. In which case, we then
trace this acquisition failure.

For now at least, disabling blocking is not supported when using fair locks
because the ReaderWriterLock.write_lock() provided by the fasteners module
doesn't implements this behavior.

Change-Id: I409da79007c9ba4fb8585da881e3d56998b0b98b

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
'description_file' instead
[1]https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I2ea9570dcf018c484054d8078f6e5a767b23dd82

commit_message:
Add support for infrastructure VMs

This change allows you to define additional VMs to deploy
on the seed-hypervisor.

Co-authored-by: Piotr Parczewski <piotr@stackhpc.com>
Co-authored-by: Will Szumski <will@stackhpc.com>
Co-authored-by: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Story: 2008741
Task: 42095
Change-Id: I8055fc5eb0a9edadcb35767303c659922f2d07ca

commit_message:
Mark unstable test_create_object_with_transfer_encoding

Let's try to unskip test_create_object_with_transfer_encoding
and see if it's still failing. The commit marks the test as
unstable so that it doesn't fail a check/gate job in case the
test fails again.

Related-Bug: #1905432
Change-Id: I84ad0a3a699cc0c04b2ce173edceb1df46f8c7a1

messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-04 17:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-04 17:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nTrivial fix to unblock this branch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 17:08:32.000000000', 'message': "doc: Avoid duplicate entry warning

Both the 'FiniteMachine' and 'HierarchicalFiniteMachine' in
'automaton.machines' define an 'Effect' attribute. It seems recent
versions of autodoc can't handle this since we're seeing the following
warning:

  automaton/machines.py:docstring of
  automaton.machines.Effect:1:duplicate object description of
  automaton.machines.Effect, other instance in reference/index, use
  :noindex: for one of them

Do as it says and configure 'noindex' for the latter. This means we lose
the ability to link to other members of this class but that's a
necessary compromise since there's no way to exclude an individual
member.

Change-Id: Ic9e50f6b56a278032463357552960e40c2ddf6a7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 45e5452482f480c0ee6cb324e790fd1c71d4eca7)
"}]
commit_message:
doc: Avoid duplicate entry warning

Both the 'FiniteMachine' and 'HierarchicalFiniteMachine' in
'automaton.machines' define an 'Effect' attribute. It seems recent
versions of autodoc can't handle this since we're seeing the following
warning:

  automaton/machines.py:docstring of
  automaton.machines.Effect:1:duplicate object description of
  automaton.machines.Effect, other instance in reference/index, use
  :noindex: for one of them

Do as it says and configure 'noindex' for the latter. This means we lose
the ability to link to other members of this class but that's a
necessary compromise since there's no way to exclude an individual
member.

Change-Id: Ic9e50f6b56a278032463357552960e40c2ddf6a7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 45e5452482f480c0ee6cb324e790fd1c71d4eca7)

subject: Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)
messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-10-01 15:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-10-02 12:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-10-04 09:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2021-10-04 09:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2021-10-04 11:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-01 15:45:57.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)

The new release include several fixes, and using a lower version
than the one available in the source system may lead to issues.
For example, a bug in 3-40 prevents the restarting of ceph-nfs
containers (see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1801090).

In general it should be possible to override the ceph parameters
through the infrared plugin as well.

Change-Id: I8c834c59cb881d739399ded56864ce4f74e1c8a8
(cherry picked from commit 1fcbed5f46fc03329a5c17034f72c69041de167a)
'}, {'created': '2021-10-04 09:36:57.000000000', 'message': 'Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)

The new release include several fixes, and using a lower version
than the one available in the source system may lead to issues.

commit_message:
Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)

The new release include several fixes, and using a lower version
than the one available in the source system may lead to issues.
For example, a bug in 3-40 prevents the restarting of ceph-nfs
containers (see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1801090).

In general it should be possible to override the ceph parameters
through the infrared plugin as well.

Change-Id: I8c834c59cb881d739399ded56864ce4f74e1c8a8
(cherry picked from commit 1fcbed5f46fc03329a5c17034f72c69041de167a)
(cherry picked from commit 8e375bcb5de6277411ce60a3da3c8a459c376763)
(cherry picked from commit 6902b7acda7a5ef6fdaef8ee5855218006caf65b)

commit_message:
Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)

The new release include several fixes, and using a lower version
than the one available in the source system may lead to issues.
For example, a bug in 3-40 prevents the restarting of ceph-nfs
containers (see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1801090).

In general it should be possible to override the ceph parameters
through the infrared plugin as well.

Change-Id: I8c834c59cb881d739399ded56864ce4f74e1c8a8
(cherry picked from commit 1fcbed5f46fc03329a5c17034f72c69041de167a)

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)

commit_message:
[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)

commit_message:
zuul: Remove trunk live migration testing

Live migrated instances with trunk ports are taking ~240 seconds to be
destroyed causing unrelated test failures thanks to libvirtd heartbeat
issues during our live migration tests.

For now these trunk tests are dropped by removing the neutron-trunk
service from the job that in turn drops the extension and allows Tempest
to skip the tests. Thanks to this the live migration tests are also
moved back to voting.

Related-Bug: #1945983
Closes-Bug: #1912310
Change-Id: I89714d87497987fe2642472ea1bbda7a20a67adb

commit_message:
Remove neutron api-paste.ini from old location

We have been configuring neutron to use /etc/neutron/api-paste.ini for
more than a month now. Remove this file from its old location before
Xena is released. Stop creating /usr/share/neutron which is now unused.

Change-Id: Ic90cd8e3065fa629d5ad67abaf7c193fd845259a

commit_message:
Remove legacy rpm install list and use bindep

The legacy rpm install list is out of date and includes
packages which no longer exist in newer distribution builds.

This functionality was entirely replaced by bindep, which is
*the* authortative file for things like this. The major difference
is the separate bindep file can't include mysql, or we break
devstack \o/.

Change-Id: Ic86f6efdf75fc2871c03e21b7f9166192b0f212c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-14 11:18:20.000000000', 'message': 'Use ansible_facts to reference facts

By default, Ansible injects a variable for every fact, prefixed with
ansible_. This can result in a large number of variables for each host,
which at scale can incur a performance penalty. Ansible provides a
configuration option [0] that can be set to False to prevent this
injection of facts. In this case, facts should be referenced via
ansible_facts.<fact>.

This change updates all references to Ansible facts within Kayobe
from using individual fact variables to using the items in the
ansible_facts dictionary. This allows users to disable fact variable
injection in their Ansible configuration, which may provide some
performance improvement.

This change disables fact variable injection in the ansible
configuration used in CI, to catch any attempts to use the injected
variables.

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/config.html#inject-facts-as-vars

commit_message:
Use ansible_facts to reference facts

By default, Ansible injects a variable for every fact, prefixed with
ansible_. This can result in a large number of variables for each host,
which at scale can incur a performance penalty. Ansible provides a
configuration option [0] that can be set to False to prevent this
injection of facts. In this case, facts should be referenced via
ansible_facts.<fact>.

This change updates all references to Ansible facts within Kayobe
from using individual fact variables to using the items in the
ansible_facts dictionary. This allows users to disable fact variable
injection in their Ansible configuration, which may provide some
performance improvement.

This change disables fact variable injection in the ansible
configuration used in CI, to catch any attempts to use the injected
variables.

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/config.html#inject-facts-as-vars

Story: 2007993
Task: 42464
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/791276

Change-Id: I14db53ed6e57d37bbd28dd5819e432e3fe6628b2
(cherry picked from commit f639ad0b3514c3a6a485b2e75082ac0b3b850454)

subject: doc: Avoid duplicate entry warning
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 14:35:24.000000000', 'message': "doc: Avoid duplicate entry warning

Both the 'FiniteMachine' and 'HierarchicalFiniteMachine' in
'automaton.machines' define an 'Effect' attribute. It seems recent
versions of autodoc can't handle this since we're seeing the following
warning:

  automaton/machines.py:docstring of
  automaton.machines.Effect:1:duplicate object description of
  automaton.machines.Effect, other instance in reference/index, use
  :noindex: for one of them

Do as it says and configure 'noindex' for the latter. This means we lose
the ability to link to other members of this class but that's a
necessary compromise since there's no way to exclude an individual
member.

Change-Id: Ic9e50f6b56a278032463357552960e40c2ddf6a7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
doc: Avoid duplicate entry warning

Both the 'FiniteMachine' and 'HierarchicalFiniteMachine' in
'automaton.machines' define an 'Effect' attribute. It seems recent
versions of autodoc can't handle this since we're seeing the following
warning:

  automaton/machines.py:docstring of
  automaton.machines.Effect:1:duplicate object description of
  automaton.machines.Effect, other instance in reference/index, use
  :noindex: for one of them

Do as it says and configure 'noindex' for the latter. This means we lose
the ability to link to other members of this class but that's a
necessary compromise since there's no way to exclude an individual
member.

Change-Id: Ic9e50f6b56a278032463357552960e40c2ddf6a7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-10-04 09:36:10.000000000', 'message': 'Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)

The new release include several fixes, and using a lower version
than the one available in the source system may lead to issues.
For example, a bug in 3-40 prevents the restarting of ceph-nfs
containers (see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1801090).

In general it should be possible to override the ceph parameters
through the infrared plugin as well.

Change-Id: I8c834c59cb881d739399ded56864ce4f74e1c8a8
(cherry picked from commit 1fcbed5f46fc03329a5c17034f72c69041de167a)
(cherry picked from commit 8e375bcb5de6277411ce60a3da3c8a459c376763)
'}]
commit_message:
Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)

The new release include several fixes, and using a lower version
than the one available in the source system may lead to issues.
For example, a bug in 3-40 prevents the restarting of ceph-nfs
containers (see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1801090).

In general it should be possible to override the ceph parameters
through the infrared plugin as well.

Change-Id: I8c834c59cb881d739399ded56864ce4f74e1c8a8
(cherry picked from commit 1fcbed5f46fc03329a5c17034f72c69041de167a)
(cherry picked from commit 8e375bcb5de6277411ce60a3da3c8a459c376763)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ib4c26c7d4d2ab379b0e9920f45588fc2f62d9be1

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

commit_message:
Add missing PY3 support in overview views

This method is ussed in Grafana Dashboards with Horizon
Authentication. The panel wasn't able to display the metrics
when dimensions are used as filter.

will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I089b818a03a57b25dfb21a2a30e37c57623e90e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 12:37:05.000000000', 'message': "Add volumev3 to shared_services_types by default

The shared_services_types parameter defines the shared services located
in the other region. This parameter by default include volume and
volumev2 but doesn't include volumev3 which represents Bloack Storage
API v3.
This change adds volumev3 to the default items so that all of volume
services are included by default.

Change-Id: Idde186b2d88321e7902e4330780aabc369754b14
(cherry picked from commit 77bde0120b57b5c1b511279e5f4131f189ada5f8)
"}]
commit_message:
Add volumev3 to shared_services_types by default

The shared_services_types parameter defines the shared services located
in the other region. This parameter by default include volume and
volumev2 but doesn't include volumev3 which represents Bloack Storage
API v3.
This change adds volumev3 to the default items so that all of volume
services are included by default.

Change-Id: Idde186b2d88321e7902e4330780aabc369754b14
(cherry picked from commit 77bde0120b57b5c1b511279e5f4131f189ada5f8)

commit_message:
Add missing PY3 support in overview views

This method is ussed in Grafana Dashboards with Horizon
Authentication. The panel wasn't able to display the metrics
when dimensions are used as filter.

(cherry picked from commit 36cc4be7400306f9a42d945e32e4496a4479b555)

commit_message:
Add sample baremetal_deployment.yaml

baremetal_deployment.yaml is a sample baremetal configuration file
for use with "openstack overcloud node provision" or "openstack
overcloud deploy --baremetal-deployment" that matches default
roles_data.yaml from tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: Idab44a83a846295679980569635a5dac0ff5055b
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-15 20:54:20.000000000', 'message': "Default network configs to Train values

With Train, net-config-bridge.j2.yaml was the default for roles tagged
with 'external_bridge'. The equivalent from the new
tripleo_network_config ansible role is templates/net_config_bridge.j2.
We should keep the default the same.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0255181dcd21dc4a50647169a20265a83057c67e
"}]
commit_message:
Default network configs to Train values

With Train, net-config-bridge.j2.yaml was the default for roles tagged
with 'external_bridge'. The equivalent from the new
tripleo_network_config ansible role is templates/net_config_bridge.j2.
We should keep the default the same.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0255181dcd21dc4a50647169a20265a83057c67e

commit_message:
Horizon: Fix parameter description

It seems parameter description was updated incorrectly and some valid
parameters are described after "DEPRECATED PARAMETERS" line.
This change fixes the parameter order to ensure valid parameters are
written before that line.

Change-Id: I8f5e45c58d9e33a544f9f0e1fa922c5e5ac8a444

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- charm-helpers sync for new charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0
- disabled hirsute-wallaby due to
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-neutron-gateway/+bug/1945746

Change-Id: I09f111993addbdaa87a1cd695dfebe78844ccd17
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-04 02:16:58.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Icb8ad06786aa09e9f18815f22e84d315cdbb1431
"}, {'created': '2021-10-04 14:39:05.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Change-Id: Icb8ad06786aa09e9f18815f22e84d315cdbb1431

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Icb8ad06786aa09e9f18815f22e84d315cdbb1431

will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I38d32c149fd64e2c9a38564dfe4c43c3df8fd180

commit_message:
Add missing *Workers into low-memory footprint env

Similarly to other services, allow configuring custom service
workers counts for Octavia API and Horizon. Also, add the
corresponding low memory env configuration for those.

Set missing *Workers conunts to 1 as well.

Change-Id: Id9119ab6cfb8b2c85a097068777b4f96a34f5d3f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Drop support for Block Storage API v2

... because it was already removed from cinder[1].

[1] e05b261af7dcd24096b229860df65dff1d385910

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- remove groovy bundlest
- charm-helpers sync for new charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

Change-Id: Ie1c6883cd66e128a10866d9b83975b2d7ecc343b

commit_message:
Add volumev3 to shared_services_types by default

The shared_services_types parameter defines the shared services located
in the other region. This parameter by default include volume and
volumev2 but doesn't include volumev3 which represents Bloack Storage
API v3.
This change adds volumev3 to the default items so that all of volume
services are included by default.

Change-Id: Idde186b2d88321e7902e4330780aabc369754b14

commit_message:
Convert dimension value type from byte to str in MonascaProxyView

To get the dimension value, urllib.parse.unquote() func is used in
MonascaProxyView._convert_dimensions. urllib.parse.unquote() func
requires str only until python3.8.

Change-Id: Ib52b4c2065dee10a96f1644cf1ec474b60147d87
(cherry picked from commit 99591546cf690324a03a4f8b50a2df090c2acbce)

commit_message:
CI: monasca: ignore exited monasca_thresh container

Ignore the monasca_thresh container if it is listed as exited.
The container was recently changed to operate as a 'one shot' container,
submitting a job to storm then exiting. This does not fit with the
usual pattern of Kolla Ansible container usage, but is harmless.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/812203

Change-Id: Id40d2260a67ef604255fb1818d41cdcbc73164d7
(cherry picked from commit 3b22d334d66adec97361fe73193334397a72af20)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-16 15:24:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix driver task pattern to reduce periodic db load

Previously, a pattern of periodic tasks was created where
nodes, and in many cases, all nodes not actively locked nor
those in maintenance state, were pulled in by a periodic task.
These periodic tasks would then create tasks which generated
additional database queries in order to populate the task object.

With the task object populated, the driver would then evaluate
if the driver in question was for the the driver interface in
question and *then* evaluate if work had to be performed.

However, that field containing a pointer to if work needed to be
performed as often already queried from the database on the
very initial query to generate the list of nodes to evaluate.

In essence, we've moved this up in the sequence so we evaluate
that field in question prior to creating the task, potentially
across every conductor, depending on the query, and ultimately
which drivers are enabled.

This saves potentially saves hundreds of thousands of needless
database queries on a medium size deployment per single day,
depending on which drivers and driver interfaces are in use.

Change-Id: I409e87de2808d442d39e4d0ae6e995668230cbba
(cherry picked from commit 4fc1abf91fe622b3eca52547dca086396acf9436)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix driver task pattern to reduce periodic db load

Previously, a pattern of periodic tasks was created where
nodes, and in many cases, all nodes not actively locked nor
those in maintenance state, were pulled in by a periodic task.
These periodic tasks would then create tasks which generated
additional database queries in order to populate the task object.

With the task object populated, the driver would then evaluate
if the driver in question was for the the driver interface in
question and *then* evaluate if work had to be performed.

However, that field containing a pointer to if work needed to be
performed as often already queried from the database on the
very initial query to generate the list of nodes to evaluate.

In essence, we've moved this up in the sequence so we evaluate
that field in question prior to creating the task, potentially
across every conductor, depending on the query, and ultimately
which drivers are enabled.

This saves potentially saves hundreds of thousands of needless
database queries on a medium size deployment per single day,
depending on which drivers and driver interfaces are in use.

Change-Id: I409e87de2808d442d39e4d0ae6e995668230cbba
(cherry picked from commit 4fc1abf91fe622b3eca52547dca086396acf9436)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 07:53:02.000000000', 'message': 'logstash: pin to 7.9.* for Elasticsearch OSS compatibility

The latest versions of logstash 7.x do not support using the OSS version
of Elasticsearch, and fail to push logs if an OSS version is used. This
prevents Monasca log API from working correctly.

This change fixes the issue by pinning logstash-oss to 7.9.x, the most
recent available package in the repo that still supports Elasticsearch
OSS.

NOTE: logstash 7.11 introduced the breaking change, however 7.10 is
unavailable in the package repos.

Change-Id: I4ec4eb837c98f57964488769ab82ba8213ad582c
Closes-Bug: #1941754
(cherry picked from commit b32cf27cc93878bcc124bcc387749829b0997a66)
'}]
commit_message:
logstash: pin to 7.9.* for Elasticsearch OSS compatibility

The latest versions of logstash 7.x do not support using the OSS version
of Elasticsearch, and fail to push logs if an OSS version is used. This
prevents Monasca log API from working correctly.

This change fixes the issue by pinning logstash-oss to 7.9.x, the most
recent available package in the repo that still supports Elasticsearch
OSS.

NOTE: logstash 7.11 introduced the breaking change, however 7.10 is
unavailable in the package repos.

Change-Id: I4ec4eb837c98f57964488769ab82ba8213ad582c
Closes-Bug: #1941754
(cherry picked from commit b32cf27cc93878bcc124bcc387749829b0997a66)

commit_message:
Fix unit tests incompatible with puppetlab-stdlib 8.0.0

Since puppetlabs-stdlib 8.0.0, ensure_packages automatically translates
'ensure => present'  to 'ensure => installed' and that translation
breaks existing assertions in unit tests.

Conflicts:
  - spec/classes/nova_key_manager_barbican_spec.rb: File is absent
    in wallaby

Change-Id: I394fc6112eb68a9f0decae275299f26e44812b44
(cherry picked from commit 123acbb3025db3a18fb202f746abd9dd68010ab3)

commit_message:
app/ofctl: fix possible deadlock

When datapath reconnects/disconnects, waiting requests on old
datapath should be canceled.  Otherwise, threads that sent
requests may fall into deadlock because replies possibly never
come.

This patch is backport of the Ryu patch [1].

Related-Bug: #1944201

[1] https://github.com/faucetsdn/ryu/commit/6f906e72c92e10bd0264c9b91a2f7bb85b97780c

Change-Id: I0bde9df2cd651b88e60631b53d69ad50f8d86d02

commit_message:
Bump the default RHCS 3 tag to the newest (3-51)

The new release include several fixes, and using a lower version
than the one available in the source system may lead to issues.
For example, a bug in 3-40 prevents the restarting of ceph-nfs
containers (see https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1801090).

In general it should be possible to override the ceph parameters
through the infrared plugin as well.

Change-Id: I8c834c59cb881d739399ded56864ce4f74e1c8a8

subject: Increase nova-cloud-controller RAM in func tests
messages: [{'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-10-04 09:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-10-04 12:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 09:00:20.000000000', 'message': 'Increase nova-cloud-controller RAM in func tests

Recent test run(s) have shown memory exhaustion on the nova
cloud controller units. This exhibits itself as the controller
dropping messages from the compute nodes and logging messages like:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_service/threadgroup.py", line 268, in _perform_action_on_threads
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_service/threadgroup.py", line 342, in <lambda>
    lambda x: x.wait(),
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_service/threadgroup.py", line 61, in wait
    return self.thread.wait()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 180, in wait
    return self._exit_event.wait()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/event.py", line 125, in wait
    result = hub.switch()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 298, in switch
    return self.greenlet.switch()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 350, in run
    self.wait(sleep_time)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/poll.py", line 80, in wait
    presult = self.do_poll(seconds)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/epolls.py", line 31, in do_poll
    return self.poll.poll(seconds)
MemoryError

to the nova-conductor log.

It seems very likely this issue is specific to Bionic Stein so it
may be a little wasteful to have increased the memory allocation
for all the bundles but I think consistancy between the bundles is
more important.

Change-Id: I1ab3e8f0d71b06fe97fa4b6cdee138c294dca158
Co-authored-by: Liam Young <liam.young@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increase nova-cloud-controller RAM in func tests

Recent test run(s) have shown memory exhaustion on the nova
cloud controller units. This exhibits itself as the controller
dropping messages from the compute nodes and logging messages like:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_service/threadgroup.py", line 268, in _perform_action_on_threads
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_service/threadgroup.py", line 342, in <lambda>
    lambda x: x.wait(),
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/oslo_service/threadgroup.py", line 61, in wait
    return self.thread.wait()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 180, in wait
    return self._exit_event.wait()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/event.py", line 125, in wait
    result = hub.switch()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 298, in switch
    return self.greenlet.switch()
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 350, in run
    self.wait(sleep_time)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/poll.py", line 80, in wait
    presult = self.do_poll(seconds)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/epolls.py", line 31, in do_poll
    return self.poll.poll(seconds)
MemoryError

to the nova-conductor log.

It seems very likely this issue is specific to Bionic Stein so it
may be a little wasteful to have increased the memory allocation
for all the bundles but I think consistancy between the bundles is
more important.

Change-Id: I1ab3e8f0d71b06fe97fa4b6cdee138c294dca158
Co-authored-by: Liam Young <liam.young@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0a1d81138dfc1647a512c2c00de39a9fb26ce5b2

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia6eedb2385740fd8824771c4f2853c58d4cac44a

commit_message:
Fix create_notification unittest and bump lower-constraints

- The method create_notification returns an uuid string, if it isn't
mocked the 'notification's id' will be:

<MagicMock name='NotificationsRepository().create_notification()'

which can't be dump to json later.

- Bump Mako to 1.0.7 in lower-constraints.txt
- Bump decorator to 4.1.0 in lower-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I1ba563fd3144241127efe1cedf8853603dcca008
(cherry picked from commit 73e942cc2e0385b6fc9575237b8ddebbc59fbe8d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-14 10:49:42.000000000', 'message': 'Use ansible_facts to reference facts

By default, Ansible injects a variable for every fact, prefixed with
ansible_. This can result in a large number of variables for each host,
which at scale can incur a performance penalty. Ansible provides a
configuration option [0] that can be set to False to prevent this
injection of facts. In this case, facts should be referenced via
ansible_facts.<fact>.

This change updates all references to Ansible facts within Kayobe
from using individual fact variables to using the items in the
ansible_facts dictionary. This allows users to disable fact variable
injection in their Ansible configuration, which may provide some
performance improvement.

This change disables fact variable injection in the ansible
configuration used in CI, to catch any attempts to use the injected
variables.

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/config.html#inject-facts-as-vars

Story: 2007993
Task: 42464
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/791276

Change-Id: I14db53ed6e57d37bbd28dd5819e432e3fe6628b2
(cherry picked from commit f639ad0b3514c3a6a485b2e75082ac0b3b850454)
'}]
commit_message:
Use ansible_facts to reference facts

By default, Ansible injects a variable for every fact, prefixed with
ansible_. This can result in a large number of variables for each host,
which at scale can incur a performance penalty. Ansible provides a
configuration option [0] that can be set to False to prevent this
injection of facts. In this case, facts should be referenced via
ansible_facts.<fact>.

This change updates all references to Ansible facts within Kayobe
from using individual fact variables to using the items in the
ansible_facts dictionary. This allows users to disable fact variable
injection in their Ansible configuration, which may provide some
performance improvement.

This change disables fact variable injection in the ansible
configuration used in CI, to catch any attempts to use the injected
variables.

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/config.html#inject-facts-as-vars

Story: 2007993
Task: 42464
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/791276

Change-Id: I14db53ed6e57d37bbd28dd5819e432e3fe6628b2
(cherry picked from commit f639ad0b3514c3a6a485b2e75082ac0b3b850454)

commit_message:
Use frontend/backend sections in HAProxy config

Now that HAProxy configurations can leverage
frontend/backend statements [1], make this the new default
for this cycle, as it allows more complex proxying
scenario that are a prerequisite for optimizing the routing
of API calls in a HA control plane.

[1] Ieb36f90c6709934aa3aa6668d3929bff872c30f5

Change-Id: Ic25c258895872210e7cf2d760769b492842f0048
Related-Bug: #1941617

Overhaul the charm README.

  received a lot of attention.

  left untouched as improvements are part of a separate

subject: Deprecate overcloud image upload to glance
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-10-03 20:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-10-04 07:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-03 20:42:39.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate overcloud image upload to glance

We don't have glance in the undercloud by default. Though we
currently fall back to upload locally if glance is not
available. Let's make local upload the default and deprecate
image upload to glance. This would help avoid looking glance
endpoint in the catalog, which would not be available in the
noauth use-case.

We'll drop GlanceClientAdapter when we remove option to enable
glance from the undercloud.

Change-Id: I1991afdb93e7019a9c29ea70e25eec5c062a98d6
(cherry picked from commit 10722b5f9768768f5f8fc58e2437946a6c2e88a2)
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate overcloud image upload to glance

We don't have glance in the undercloud by default. Though we
currently fall back to upload locally if glance is not
available. Let's make local upload the default and deprecate
image upload to glance. This would help avoid looking glance
endpoint in the catalog, which would not be available in the
noauth use-case.

We'll drop GlanceClientAdapter when we remove option to enable
glance from the undercloud.

Change-Id: I1991afdb93e7019a9c29ea70e25eec5c062a98d6
(cherry picked from commit 10722b5f9768768f5f8fc58e2437946a6c2e88a2)

We seem to have cargo culted this since Ussuri for no good reason. Docs
are published for this package so we should include them.

Change-Id: I5ac2a04e8f58d72e2e529e6ea46ca636fad45288
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Disable TraceEnable to satisfy security scanners

Disable TraceEnable to satisfy security scanners
and since this is not needed on the image serve
service, no features will be affected.

Change-Id: I25242f740af7fe817bb34eb8ab70ef5617f559db

commit_message:
[www] Remove references to retired projects

networking-ovn is now part of neutron core and not a separate project,
so remove this from the "latest" project data. Also remove errant
references to projects in the "wallaby" project data that should have
been removed when their corresponding reference was removed from
"latest". Finally, uncomment some projects in "latest" to ensure their
docs are actually built by default and only disabled by choice, rather
than because the commenting out was cargo culted.

Change-Id: I219668125b3fe3e834a9260c4bae0ed42905fd78
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Many (though not all) of the remaining projects are all retired and will
be removed from the template post-haste.

commit_message:
[www] Add more Victoria links

Virtually all projects have published Victoria docs now. Link to them.
The remaining projects are all retired and will be removed from the
template post-haste.

Change-Id: Ibac951e61c713278f2f420fb52cd428a838e5b50
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Thanks, I added pike, but only for neutron-vpnaas not for dashboard'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-09-16 12:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-09-16 13:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-09-17 09:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-09-17 12:53:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

recheck
Based on release channel's discussion the gate is free"}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-09-17 16:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Should we get https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809185 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809186 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809183 in and use the new hashes? to drop periodic jobs. Or will this be done with EOL process?'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-09-27 08:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> Should we get https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809185 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809186 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809183 in and use the new hashes? to drop periodic jobs. Or will this be done with EOL process?

Indeed these patches could be included before moving to EOL. The branches will be deleted after eoling the deliverables so if these patches are not merged before then they will be lost. Merging them first will backup them in the eol tag.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-09-27 08:45:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> > Patch Set 5:
> > 
> > Should we get https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809185 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809186 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/+/809183 in and use the new hashes? to drop periodic jobs. Or will this be done with EOL process?
> 
> Indeed these patches could be included before moving to EOL. The branches will be deleted after eoling the deliverables so if these patches are not merged before then they will be lost. Merging them first will backup them in the eol tag.

Sorry for the late answer and thanks Hervé for the answer. To add some more detail for the answer:

* it is not necessary to delete zuul jobs from .zuul.yaml on the branch that will be EOL'd, because as soon as the branch gets deleted zuul won't pick up any jobs from there
* it is NECESSARY to delete zuul job definitions that are defined in OTHER repository than neutron-vpnaas AND won't be used anymore (i.e. the job is only used in the to-be-deleted branches of neutron-vpnaas), so that we won't have 'dead code' among zuul job definitions
* to be able to delete a branch after it is tagged as EOL all open patches should be abandoned

TL;DR: we don't need those job dropping patches to be merged"}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-09-27 11:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Thanks Elod and Hervé, so this looks good to go in then! (and then clean the mentioned patches to actaully delete the branch)'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-10-04 09:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-10-04 09:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

LGTM:
* mail was sent to ML almost a month ago
* hashes look correct (all from head of the given stable/* branch)
* approved by PTL'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-10-04 09:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-15 12:43:02.000000000', 'message': '[vpnaas] Transition stein, rocky, queens to EOL

This patch transitions stable/stein, stable/rocky and stable/queens
branches to End of Life. This was discussed on Neutron CI meeting
(see [1]) and a mail was sent out to the community (see [2]).
These branches cannot be used anymore and will be deleted if this patch
merges.

[1]: https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/%23openstack-neutron.2021-09-07.log.html#t2021-09-07T15:18:43
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-September/024779.html

commit_message:
[vpnaas] Transition stein, rocky, queens, pike to EOL

This patch transitions stable/stein, stable/rocky, stable/queens
and stable/pike branches to End of Life. This was discussed on Neutron
CI meeting (see [1]) and a mail was sent out to the community (see [2]).
These branches cannot be used anymore and will be deleted if this patch
merges.

[1]: https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/%23openstack-neutron.2021-09-07.log.html#t2021-09-07T15:18:43
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-September/024779.html

Change-Id: Ic7ed1133f81d1637429aa7a69eaa7e799ed5bd65

[{'created': '2021-09-17 07:54:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix iDRAC import configuration missing task handling

Older iDRACs delete the task after 1 minute, since 5.00.00.00
the task is being kept for 10 minutes.
However, if encountering the issue, handle it and advise
user to either upgrade iDRAC if not already or decrease
checking interval.
Prior this node got stuck in wait mode forever if task was
deleted as raised exception by periodic didn't make the step
fail.

Change-Id: I5d500b7d53e9804aa3b54dc400d8621f40cd5d0c
(cherry picked from commit c174380db3eb409d8fd601b76e7027ea5c0f319c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix iDRAC import configuration missing task handling

Older iDRACs delete the task after 1 minute, since 5.00.00.00
the task is being kept for 10 minutes.
However, if encountering the issue, handle it and advise
user to either upgrade iDRAC if not already or decrease
checking interval.
Prior this node got stuck in wait mode forever if task was
deleted as raised exception by periodic didn't make the step
fail.

Change-Id: I5d500b7d53e9804aa3b54dc400d8621f40cd5d0c
(cherry picked from commit c174380db3eb409d8fd601b76e7027ea5c0f319c)

commit_message:
Fix iDRAC import configuration job with errors

In iDRAC import configuration task can be completed with OK health
but having some errors, for example, when one disk failed to be
created and another succeeded.
Also changed to exclude informational messages for error reporting.

Story: 2009198
Task: 43253

Change-Id: I02b63547566c94ffa1a5d0e84bd1b1f10d28bfc3
(cherry picked from commit 391543946b6c3cb21ae1c08a21b6f730926c9b9d)

subject: Fix prometheus-elasticsearch-exporter flags
messages:
[{'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-07-06 09:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-08 08:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The 1.0.2 version used in Train uses the single dash options. In ussuri we have 1.1.0. From release notes:

[BREAKING] commandline flags are now POSIX flags with double dashes --

https://github.com/prometheus-community/elasticsearch_exporter/releases/tag/v1.1.0'}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-07-08 09:12:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> The 1.0.2 version used in Train uses the single dash options. In ussuri we have 1.1.0. From release notes:
> 
> [BREAKING] commandline flags are now POSIX flags with double dashes --
> 
> https://github.com/prometheus-community/elasticsearch_exporter/releases/tag/v1.1.0

Aaaah yeah, you're right, we've update our exporter version to 1.1.0 earlier and 1.2.0 currently.
I'll update the container versioning in order to reflect this change if you're OK."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-08 09:15:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > The 1.0.2 version used in Train uses the single dash options. In ussuri we have 1.1.0. From release notes:
> > 
> > [BREAKING] commandline flags are now POSIX flags with double dashes --
> > 
> > https://github.com/prometheus-community/elasticsearch_exporter/releases/tag/v1.1.0
> 
> Aaaah yeah, you're right, we've update our exporter version to 1.1.0 earlier and 1.2.0 currently.
> I'll update the container versioning in order to reflect this change if you're OK.

Train is in Extended Maintenance. I'm not sure what our policy is around bumping versions. Does it fix a security bug?"}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-07-08 09:26:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > The 1.0.2 version used in Train uses the single dash options. In ussuri we have 1.1.0. From release notes:
> > > 
> > > [BREAKING] commandline flags are now POSIX flags with double dashes --
> > > 
> > > https://github.com/prometheus-community/elasticsearch_exporter/releases/tag/v1.1.0
> > 
> > Aaaah yeah, you're right, we've update our exporter version to 1.1.0 earlier and 1.2.0 currently.
> > I'll update the container versioning in order to reflect this change if you're OK.
> 
> Train is in Extended Maintenance. I'm not sure what our policy is around bumping versions. Does it fix a security bug?

It's hard to tell, we did bumped the version on our side as it fixed a metric that doesn't worked with current version, but the community releasing the exporter doesn't really expose if bugfix is security fix."}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-10-04 09:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Train is best effort and CICD is a mess.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-06 09:53:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix prometheus-elasticsearch-exporter flags

The flag -es.uri is no longer accepted - it should be --es.uri.
Similarly with -web.listen-address. The following error is seen:

    elasticsearch_exporter: error: unknown short flag '-e', try --help

This change switches to double dashed long options.

Change-Id: I039f4cad970352146462450742056f5990a81b06
Closes-Bug: #1880242

commit_message:
Fix prometheus-elasticsearch-exporter flags

The flag -es.uri is no longer accepted - it should be --es.uri.
Similarly with -web.listen-address. The following error is seen:

    elasticsearch_exporter: error: unknown short flag '-e', try --help

This change switches to double dashed long options.

Change-Id: I039f4cad970352146462450742056f5990a81b06
Closes-Bug: #1880242
(cherry picked from commit 96a1ce196e08e2bf7d82e3e6d24b66197c4736d5)

[{'created': '2021-09-20 14:59:52.000000000', 'message': 'Always update cache for HTTP images if Last Modified is unknown

Currently we default to assuming the cache is up-to-date. This is likely
wrong. Normal web servers provide Last Modified for files they serve.
If it is absent, chances are high the image is served by some sort
of a dynamic service, which may modify the URL on fly.

In any case, always updating the image is a safer choice.

Change-Id: I0548db14a97638d26ebb687e8f47f1b295d1f774
(cherry picked from commit 94a1560d31b72052a94c0a4c07db2f9cf957ff26)

commit_message:
Always update cache for HTTP images if Last Modified is unknown

Currently we default to assuming the cache is up-to-date. This is likely
wrong. Normal web servers provide Last Modified for files they serve.
If it is absent, chances are high the image is served by some sort
of a dynamic service, which may modify the URL on fly.

In any case, always updating the image is a safer choice.

Change-Id: I0548db14a97638d26ebb687e8f47f1b295d1f774
(cherry picked from commit 94a1560d31b72052a94c0a4c07db2f9cf957ff26)

commit_message:
Add missing slash

The default of 'domain_config_dir' in keystone is '/etc/keystone/domains'.
This patch adds the missing slash.

Change-Id: I30523ec3fd3144811a76b9078e915eff4ffa2b66

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 16:38:03.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix "_sync_metadata_ports" with no DHCP subnets

When a subnet does not have DHCP configured, the metadata port does
not have an IP address on this CIDR. The method
"OvnNbSynchronizer.sync_networks_ports_and_dhcp_opts", was always
setting an IP address for the metadata ports, regardless of the subnet
configuration (with or without DHCP).

The method "_sync_metadata_ports", in charge of synchronizing the
metadata ports, now filters the subnets by the parameter "enable_dhcp".

In case of having a subnet with DHCP enabled, if the metadata port is
missing the subnet IP addresses, the method adds them.

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port
has an IP address on the subnet, the method removes it.

Closes-Bug: #1939726
Change-Id: I09cc14dff6933aae63cbd43a29f9221f405ecede
'}, {'created': '2021-10-01 08:44:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "_sync_metadata_ports" with no DHCP subnets

When a subnet does not have DHCP configured, the metadata port does
not have an IP address on this CIDR. The method
"OvnNbSynchronizer.sync_networks_ports_and_dhcp_opts", was always
setting an IP address for the metadata ports, regardless of the subnet
configuration (with or without DHCP).

The method "_sync_metadata_ports", in charge of synchronizing the
metadata ports, now filters the subnets by the parameter "enable_dhcp".

In case of having a subnet with DHCP enabled, if the metadata port is
missing the subnet IP addresses, the method adds them.

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port
has an IP address on the subnet, the method removes it.

Closes-Bug: #1939726
Change-Id: I09cc14dff6933aae63cbd43a29f9221f405ecede
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "_sync_metadata_ports" with no DHCP subnets

When a subnet does not have DHCP configured, the metadata port does
not have an IP address on this CIDR. The method
"OvnNbSynchronizer.sync_networks_ports_and_dhcp_opts", was always
setting an IP address for the metadata ports, regardless of the subnet
configuration (with or without DHCP).

The method "_sync_metadata_ports", in charge of synchronizing the
metadata ports, now filters the subnets by the parameter "enable_dhcp".

In case of having a subnet with DHCP enabled, if the metadata port is
missing the subnet IP addresses, the method adds them.

In case of having a subnet without DHCP enabled, if the metadata port
has an IP address on the subnet, the method removes it.

Closes-Bug: #1939726
Change-Id: I09cc14dff6933aae63cbd43a29f9221f405ecede

Change-Id: Ib52b4c2065dee10a96f1644cf1ec474b60147d87
'}]
commit_message:
Convert dimension value type from byte to str in MonascaProxyView

To get the dimension value, urllib.parse.unquote() func is used in
MonascaProxyView._convert_dimensions. urllib.parse.unquote() func
requires str only until python3.8.

Change-Id: Ib52b4c2065dee10a96f1644cf1ec474b60147d87

commit_message:
Retire puppet-freezer

This module has been incomplete and doesn't support very fundamental
resources like packages, services and so on. Because we haven't seen
any effort to complete its implementation for a long and we have
received no objections to dropping the module[1], I'd propose retiring
this module from Puppet OpenStack now.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-September/024687.html

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/808675/
Change-Id: Id20a81ac942d235e1d4b029b4689c4d5afa7c012

A good example of such a package upstream is rdo-release[1] which

commit_message:
Add DIB_YUM_REPO_PACKAGE as an alternative to DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF

A custom yum repository can now be configured by defining
`DIB_YUM_REPO_PACKAGE` as a yum available package or a URL to an rpm file.
This package can install repo files with any associated keys and
certificates.

A good example of such a package upstream is rdo-release[1] which
includes multiple repo files, the repo keys, and a root certificate.
This makes these repos impractical to install via DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF.

Downstream, repo packages like this a frequently used to bootstrap
development builds of RHEL with development repos.

[1] https://www.rdoproject.org/repos/rdo-release.rpm

Change-Id: I2832e723998c9bd7635cdf7541a4c20eff6294d2

commit_message:
Support grubby and the Bootloader Spec

Fedora 30 and RHEL-8.2 onwards support the Bootloader Spec and use grubby
to manage kernel menu entries and kernel arguments.
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/BootLoaderSpecByDefault

This change detects if this is a BLS enabled environment, and uses
grubby to set kernel arguments on all kernel entries if it is.

Change-Id: I2701260d54cf6bc79f1ac765b512d99d799e8c43

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 23:01:17.000000000', 'message': "Move grubenv to EFI dir, add a symlink back

If the grubenv is regenerated, its changes won't be available to UEFI
boot systems unless the changed grubenv is copied to the EFI
directory. RHEL packaging handles this by making /boot/grub2/grubenv a
symlink to the grubenv in the EFI directory. However, change
I5591144a3617dbae148b0c5d2a6a404942ffcd4e removed this symlink because
it breaks when the EFI directory isn't populated.

This change adds the symlink back once the EFI directory is populated.

Change-Id: I512502117a6bf1e6122fdfd8965ca488b4a5bae4
"}, {'created': '2021-08-17 05:36:51.000000000', 'message': "Move grubenv to EFI dir, add a symlink back

directory. RHEL packaging handles this by making /boot/grub2/grubenv a
symlink to the grubenv in the EFI directory. However, change
I5591144a3617dbae148b0c5d2a6a404942ffcd4e removed this symlink because
it breaks when the EFI directory isn't populated.

This change adds the symlink back once the EFI directory is populated.

Change-Id: I512502117a6bf1e6122fdfd8965ca488b4a5bae4
"}, {'created': '2021-08-20 01:19:00.000000000', 'message': "Move grubenv to EFI dir

"}, {'created': '2021-09-12 21:33:08.000000000', 'message': "Move grubenv to EFI dir

commit_message:
Move grubenv to EFI dir

If the grubenv is regenerated, its changes won't be available to UEFI
boot systems unless the changed grubenv is copied to the EFI
directory.

This change copies the grubenv to the EFI directory when the grub.cfg
is copied.

Change-Id: I512502117a6bf1e6122fdfd8965ca488b4a5bae4

commit_message:
Use tcib_extras in container-build role

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-operator-ansible/+/808055
adds the support of tcib_extras in container build and is used here
in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/800580.

In order to work content provider successfully, we need the
tcib_extras vars in container-build role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/807257
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-operator-ansible/+/808055
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/811188/

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I913cd3397395c84830d5ac5789135456810b2641

commit_message:
Convert featureset minimal to use ephemeral heat

This featuresets still deploy installed heat, Converting
it to use ephermal heat.

Test was failing master jobs in ci.centos.

Change-Id: Ibbe125c2825cba36270f5f46ebbec4e7150a3464
Related-Bug: #1944217

[{'created': '2021-09-28 00:23:27.000000000', 'message': 'Bug: fix s3api multipart parts listings

s3api returns multipart parts listings out of order and possibly
missing. For example, if there are 2000 parts, the first 12 parts
returned by s3api currently will be: 1, 10-19, 100. Then after part
189, the follwing part is 1000.

The change fixes this behavior by internally listing all of the parts
(with default settings, this should be 1 listing request, as the 10000
parts limit matches the Swift listing limit). After that, the parts are
sorted and delimited/marker settings are applied to craft the response
for the client.

Change-Id: I150cf53b07e7d2d8de1d6e8c1fb08c07b9afe842

commit_message:
Bug: fix s3api multipart parts listings

s3api returns multipart parts listings out of order and possibly
missing. For example, if there are 2000 parts, the first 12 parts
returned by s3api currently will be: 1, 10-19, 100. Then after part
199, the following part is 1000, and so on.

The change fixes this behavior by internally listing all of the parts
(with default settings, this should be 1 listing request, as the 10000
parts limit matches the Swift listing limit). After that, the parts are
sorted and delimited/marker settings are applied to craft the response
for the client.

Change-Id: I150cf53b07e7d2d8de1d6e8c1fb08c07b9afe842

Do not test detail of keystone::resource::service_identity

... but test interfaces of that resource type. This helps us avoid
direct breakage caused by any change in puppet-keystone.

commit_message:
Fixing nova's helm.sh/hook disablement

It's impossible to disable the helm.sh/hook for the nova-ks-service
job since the hook is being added in duplicity to the job dictionary
before the check for Values.helm3_hook. This commit removes the
duplicity so we can disable it properly.

Signed-off-by: Thiago Brito <thiago.brito@windriver.com>
Change-Id: Ie72a13afc81bce4424b10bbc542dc7c44dd38975

(6 comments)

Thanks y'all for reviewing. I removed the uninstall as suggested, and also fixed the condition. My only concern right now is the naming scheme. I might be missing some bits here but I thought that moving to mkisofs naming was a good idea because this is the command that we're going to call. This command is provided by either genisoimage or xorriso. Let me know if that makes sense, I can revisit if we prefer to keep the genisoimage naming."}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-09-29 17:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-30 00:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I still think we should avoid adding a new parameter, which I pointed in the previous comment.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-09-30 13:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-30 14:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Hmm... After I recheck the bugzilla linked an am a little bit confused now.
Do you mind helping me understand the following points ?

1) Which one of xorriso and mkisofs should be install ? The comment by Lee in bz indicates mkisofs should be used but this patch tries to install xorriso.

2) Does mkifofs(or xorriso) provide symlink to the genisoimage command ?'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-09-30 18:04:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Hmm... After I recheck the bugzilla linked an am a little bit confused now.
> Do you mind helping me understand the following points ?
> 
> 1) Which one of xorriso and mkisofs should be install ? The comment by Lee in bz indicates mkisofs should be used but this patch tries to install xorriso.
> 
> 2) Does mkifofs(or xorriso) provide symlink to the genisoimage command ?

AFAIK, mkisofs is not a package per se, it's a command provided by either genisoimage or xorriso. In RHEL realm, it's managed by alternatives and points to either xorriso or genisoimage. In Debian realm, it's a symlink to genisoimage. In RHEL, we removed genisoimage from from centos:9 and replaced with xorriso. Centos:8 has both packages available so we can install either.

Before this whole thing, nova was simply using genisoimage. Lee's efforts are to use mkisofs by default instead."}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-09-30 18:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-10-01 00:36:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-01 02:29:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Sorry I noticed I missed/misunderstood some important points during reviews. My apologize about confusions caused by my inconsistency.

The current patch looks good to me. -1 because of unnecessary spaces added and the commit message.

So IIUC we need to change mkisofs_cmd in CentOS9, because xorriso package does not provide genisoimage command. Is that right ?

It would be an option to implement a logic in puppet-nova layer if the current default if nova never works but I'm wondering it is something we can implement in nova-dist.conf rather than here. IIUC dist.conf is the place where we put defaults specific to OS and allow RDO users leverage that switch implementation without puppet."}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-10-01 02:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-10-01 03:03:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> Sorry I noticed I missed/misunderstood some important points during reviews. My apologize about confusions caused by my inconsistency.

No hard feelings here, Takashisan, we appreciate your hard work and generous contributions to the code and reviews.

> So IIUC we need to change mkisofs_cmd in CentOS9, because xorriso package does not provide genisoimage command. Is that right ?

I won't pinky swear here but that's my understanding as well. Based on this BZ [1], RH has opted to replace genisoimage with xorriso in a very near future. Since both genisoimage and xorriso are symlinked to mkisofs, it only makes sense to leverage that link.

> It would be an option to implement a logic in puppet-nova layer if the current default if nova never works but I'm wondering it is something we can implement in nova-dist.conf rather than here. IIUC dist.conf is the place where we put defaults specific to OS and allow RDO users leverage that switch implementation without puppet.

We thought that puppet-nova should default to whatever nova is and we were leaning to change it in tripleo if nova change doesn't go through for some reason. nova-dist.conf is also a valid option we're going to evaluate if we need to force it. For now, we're just opening the door in puppet-nova.

Again, thanks for your time.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1971840"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-01 14:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-10-01 14:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

very well done'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-03 12:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for updating the patch. I'll merge the current version but we can revisit the default value of mkisofs_cmd, once we investigate the other approaches like dist.conf I mentioned."}]

commit_message:
Add support for [DEFAULT] mkisofs_cmd

Since genisoimage is no longuer maintained, RHEL/CentOS family
is going toward xorriso path which provides dropin replacement.

While mkisofs command is either a symlink to alternatives (rhel)
or to genisoimage (debian), we should control this parameter and
install appropriate package.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2002949
Closes-Bug: #1945051
Change-Id: Id20319ca2c5d4b458b566ca878ca83db51d240e1

But in all.pp does not include the option to enable/disable xinetd, i guess it should be added there too?'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-15 11:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-06-15 11:53:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-06-22 14:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-09-28 09:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-09-28 09:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-09-28 09:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-09-28 11:02:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

swift::storage has $rsync_use_xinetd parameter:

https://github.com/openstack/puppet-swift/blob/master/manifests/storage.pp#L28

But when it's called from swift::storage::all it's not configurable, what will lead to issues in CS9:

https://github.com/openstack/puppet-swift/blob/master/manifests/storage/all.pp#L171

We should be able to set the parameter from ::all or maybe make the default value for rsync_use_xinetd to switch to false for CS9 (or both)."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-28 12:57:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1
> 
> swift::storage has $rsync_use_xinetd parameter:
> 
> https://github.com/openstack/puppet-swift/blob/master/manifests/storage.pp#L28
> 
> But when it's called from swift::storage::all it's not configurable, what will lead to issues in CS9:
> 
> https://github.com/openstack/puppet-swift/blob/master/manifests/storage/all.pp#L171

Although we can override the parameter outside of swift::storage::all (by defining defaults), it makes sense to me to implement an interface to swift::storage::all as well for easy switching.

> We should be able to set the parameter from ::all or maybe make the default value for rsync_use_xinetd to switch to false for CS9 (or both).

I think you can follow what I proposed here about this.
 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-ironic/+/797668/37/manifests/params.pp
Basically what I'd suggest is to implement a parameter to represent availability of xinetd in the base params class and use the parameter to define default value and validate user input."}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-09-30 09:55:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-09-30 09:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-09-30 10:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-30 11:05:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Also, please add a release note to explain the new parameters.'}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-09-30 12:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-10-01 06:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

> Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1
> 
> (4 comments)
> 
> Also, please add a release note to explain the new parameters.

Thank you Takashi for the assistance. Now we'are hitting an issue which does not seem related to the change after deep investigation. Do you have an idea of what could be the reason of 
'expected that the catalogue would contain Package[xfsprogs] with ensure set to "present" but it is set to "installed"' ?'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-01 07:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-01 07:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-01 07:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-01 07:18:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

(1 comment)

Good catch. That error seems to be the known issue caused by recent bump of puppetlabs-stdlib. I have submitted a fix for it(which is now the parent patch of this) and let's see whether it works.

I also made some minor updates with adding validation to prevent usage of xinetd in CentOS9. Hope all look good to you."}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-10-01 07:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

Thanks Takashi for your help!'}, {'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2021-10-01 08:00:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 16:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Good catch. That error seems to be the known issue caused by recent bump of puppetlabs-stdlib. I have submitted a fix for it(which is now the parent patch of this) and let's see whether it works.
> 
> I also made some minor updates with adding validation to prevent usage of xinetd in CentOS9. Hope all look good to you.

All good for the changes added, thank you"}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-10-01 09:26:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

There is some problem with latest promotion in tripleo. Fripn #oooq channel:

<arxcruz|ruck> amoralej: not a problem with the job, the problem was the toolbox, it was without dns (don't know why) and so it wasn't able to tag it properly"}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-10-01 13:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-10 15:18:59.000000000', 'message': "Add 'rsync_use_xinetd' as argument to swift::ringserver

Plus, we add a dependency on rsync-daemon in CentOS >= 8
when not using xinetd.
Since CentOS 8, rsyncd systemd unit is shipped in a
different package, rsync-dameon.
When setting 'rsync_use_xinetd' to false in swift::ringserver
and/or swift::storage, this package should be installed for
CentOS >= 8.

Change-Id: I85abf3811d61fa8bfc0a1607818d6495549b5a6b
